SourceText: *Tummy Time Safari*
text: *Magietyd-Safari*

SourceText: Time for an adventure - right on the floor! 🌱
text: Tyd vir 'n avontuur - hier op die vloer🌱

SourceText: ✅ Lay a soft blanket on the floor and gently place your baby on their tummy. Put a few colourful toys or soft books just out of reach, and see your baby reach for them.
text: ✅ Plaas 'n sagte kombers op die vloer en sit jou baba versigtig op sy/haar magie neer. Sit 'n paar kleurvolle speelgoed of sagte boekies net buite bereik en kyk hoe baba uitreik daarvoor.

SourceText: 👀 Talk, sing, or lie down face-to-face to keep them engaged.
text: 👀 Praat, sing of lê aangesig tot aangesig om hom/haar besig te hou.

SourceText: 🧸 Make it playful - wiggle a toy or a plastic bottle with some rice like an animal exploring the jungle! “Look, here comes a lion!”
text: 🧸 Maak dit speel-speel - wikkel 'n speelding rond, of 'n plastiekbottel met rys in, soos 'n dier wat die oerwoud verken! "Kyk, hier kom die leeu!"

SourceText: Tummy time is essential for your baby’s physical development and builds the strength they’ll need to crawl and sit ⭐
text: Magietyd is noodsaaklik vir jou baba se fisiese ontwikkeling, en dit bou sy/haar krag op wat hy/sy nodig het om te kruip en te sit⭐

SourceText: *Face to Face Fun*
text: *Aangesig-tot-Aangesig-Pret*

SourceText: Babies love looking at faces - especially yours! 😃
text: Babas hou daarvan om na gesigte te kyk - veral joune! 😃

SourceText: 👑 Sit comfortably and hold your baby so you’re face-to-face. Make funny faces, raise your eyebrows, puff your cheeks, and talk or sing gently.
text: 👑 Sit gemaklik en hou jou baba so dat julle na mekaar kyk. Trek snaakse gesigte, lig jou wenkbroue, blaas jou wange op en gesels of sing saggies.

SourceText: 🚩 Watch as your baby starts to copy you! Peek-a-boo and big smiles are great ways to bond.
text: 🚩 Kyk hoe jou baba jou naboots! Koekeloerspeletjies en breë glimlaggies is wonderlike maniere om 'n band te vorm.

SourceText: This activity helps your baby develop emotional connection, eye contact, and early social skills - all while having fun together 🎉
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit help jou baba om emosionele verbondenheid, oogkontak en vroeë sosiale vaardighede te ontwikkel - alles terwyl julle pret het 🎉

SourceText: *Sing & Sway*
text: *Sing & Swaai*

SourceText: 🎵 Hold your baby close and gently sway together to the rhythm of a soft song. You can hum or sing a lullaby as you move, making eye contact and smiling as you go.
text: 🎵 Hou jou baba vas en swaai sagkens op die ritme van 'n sagte liedjie. Jy kan neurie of 'n wiegeliedjie sing terwyl jy beweeg; maak oogkontak en glimlag terwyl jy beweeg.

SourceText: 🔄 Try singing the same song each day - it creates a lovely routine and helps your baby recognise familiar sounds over time.
text: 🔄 Probeer om elke dag dieselfde liedjie te sing - dit skep 'n goeie roetine en dit help jou baba om, met verloop van tyd, bekende klanke te herken.

SourceText: The soothing movement helps your baby feel safe and connected, while the sound of your voice supports early language development and emotional bonding 💛
text: Die strelende bewegings help dat jou baba veilig en verbonde voel, terwyl jou stem vroeë taalontwikkeling en emosionele verbondenheid ondersteun 💛

SourceText: It’s a simple, calming way to bond and build your baby’s growing brain through rhythm, movement, and love 🌙
text: Dis 'n eenvoudige, kalmerende manier om 'n band te vorm en jou baba se groeiende brein deur ritme, beweging en liefde te bou 🌙

SourceText: *Toe Tickle Talk*
text: *Toonkielie-Geselsies*

SourceText: Let’s explore toes and fingers with a gentle tickle and some fun words! 👋
text: Kom ons verken die tone en vingers met 'n sagte gekielie en 'n paar prettige woorde👋

SourceText: ▶️ Start by wiggling your baby’s toes or fingers one at a time while counting them, saying your own silly rhyme, or simply naming the toes and fingers: “Tickle your tiny toe!” or “Hello little thumb!”
text: ▶️ Begin deur jou baba se tone of vingers een vir een te wikkel terwyl jy dit tel en jou eie verspotte rympies sê, of om eenvoudig net die tone en vingers te noem: "Kielie jou kleintoontjie!" of "Hallo, klein duimpie!"

SourceText: This activity strengthens your baby’s awareness of their body and supports early language learning - all while sharing giggles and smiles 🎉
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit versterk jou baba se bewustheid van sy/haar liggaam en dit ondersteun vroeë taalvaardighede - alles terwyl julle saam giggel en glimlag🎉

SourceText: *Follow the Sound*
text: *Volg die Klank*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world of sound! 📻
text: Kom ons verken die wêreld van klanke! 📻

SourceText: 💡 Find something in your house that makes a gentle sound, like some rice in a packet or a plastic bag.
text: 💡 Kry iets in die huis wat 'n sagte geluid maak, soos rys in 'n pakkie of 'n plastieksak.

SourceText: 👂 Gently make a sound with the object near your baby’s ear - first on one side, then pause and try the other.
text: 👂 Maak saggies 'n geluid met die voorwerp naby jou baba se oor - eers aan die een kant, wag, probeer dan die ander kant.

SourceText: 👀 Watch how your baby turns their head to follow the noise. You can even say, “Over here!” as you move the sound.
text: 👀 Kyk hoe jou baba sy/haar kop draai om die geluid te volg. Jy kan ook sê: "Hierdie kant" wanneer jy die klank beweeg.

SourceText: This is a lovely, quiet way to play together - and it helps your baby start to understand how sound connects to movement. It supports their attention and brain development 🌱
text: Dit is 'n wonderlike, vinnige manier om saam te speel - en dit help jou baba om te verstaan hoe klank met beweging verband hou. Dit ondersteun sy/haar aandagspan- en breinontwikkeling 🌱

SourceText: *Story Cuddles*
text: * Storiedrukkies*

SourceText: It’s never too early to share a story! 📖
text: Dis nooit te vroeg om 'n storie te deel nie! 📖

SourceText: 👂 Hold your baby close and tell them a simple story – you can tell them about your day or memories from when you were young, or you can make up a short story.
text: 👂 Hou jou baba vas en vertel 'n eenvoudige storie - jy kan hom/haar vertel van jou dag of herinneringe van jou jonger self, of jy kan 'n kort storie opmaak.

SourceText: 💙 Your baby may not understand what you are saying yet, but the sound of your voice, your expressions, and the closeness all help them feel safe and connected.
text: 💙 Jou baba verstaan dalk nog nie wat jy sê nie, maar die geluid van jou stem, jou gesigsuitdrukkings en nabyheid help dat hy/sy veilig en verbonde voel.

SourceText: 👀 If you share a story from a book, you can point to pictures and describe what you see: “Look, a dog! The dog is playing outside.”
text: 👀 As jy 'n storie uit 'n boek deel, kan jy na die prentjies wys en beskryf wat jy sien: "Kyk, 'n hond! Die hond speel buite."

SourceText: Story telling builds language, imagination, and a love of stories and reading - right from the start. And cuddling up together makes it even more special ✨
text: Om 'n storie te vertel, bou taalvaardigheid, verbeelding en 'n liefde vir stories en lees - reg van die begin af. En om snoesig saam te wees, maak dit baie meer spesiaal ✨

SourceText: *Name That Sound*
text: *Benoem Daardie Klank*

SourceText: Make everyday noises into a fun game! 🎵
text: Omskep alledaagse geluide in 'n prettige speletjie!🎵

SourceText: 🔑 Use objects like a crinkly bag, keys, or tapping a cup. Make a sound and then pause.
text: 🔑 Gebruik voorwerpe soos 'n kreukelrige sak, sleutels, of tik op 'n koppie. Maak 'n geluid en wag dan.

SourceText: 👂 Say what it is: “Crinkle, crinkle! That’s the bag!” or “Clink clink! That’s the keys!” Watch your baby’s reaction - do they turn toward the sound? Do they smile or blink?
text: 👂 Sê wat dit is: "Kreukel-kreukel! Dis die sak!" of "Rinkel-rinkel! Dis die sleutels!" Hou dop hoe jou baba reageer - draai hy/sy na die geluid? Glimlag hy/sy of knip hy/sy sy/haar oë?

SourceText: This activity builds your baby’s listening and attention skills while helping them begin to link sounds to the world around them.
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit bou jou baba se luister- en aandagvaardighede; dit help ook om 'n band met die wêreld om ons te vorm.

SourceText: Even the smallest sounds can open up a big world of discovery! 🌈
text: Selfs die kleinste geluide kan 'n groot wêreld van ontdekking oopmaak! 🌈

SourceText: *Follow the Beat*
text: *Hou die Ritme*

SourceText: 🎵 Use your hands to gently clap or pat a simple rhythm on your little one’s legs or arms: “Ta-ta-ta... ta-ta!”
text: 🎵 Gebruik jou hande om saggies te klap, of tik 'n eenvoudige ritme op jou kleinding se been of arm uit: "Ta-ta-ta ... ta-ta!

SourceText: 😃 Then pause and smile - do they respond? Your little one may wiggle, kick, or if they are a bit older they may even copy the rhythm.
text: 😃 Wag dan en glimlag - reageer hy/sy? Jou kleinding sal dalk wikkel, skop, of as hy/sy 'n bietjie ouer is, sal hy/sy dalk die ritme naboots.

SourceText: This playful call-and-response builds listening, rhythm, and connection - just like traditional music has done for generations 💚
text: Hierdie prettige roep-en-reageer bou luister, ritme en verbondenheid - net soos tradisionele musiek vir generasies gedoen het💚

SourceText: *Scarf Peekabo*
text: *Serp-Koekeloer*

SourceText: It’s peekaboo time - with a twist! 🎁
text: Dis koekeloertyd - met 'n kinkel! 🎁

SourceText: 🔶 Grab a soft scarf or cloth and gently hide your face behind it.
text: 🔶 Gryp 'n sagte serp of lap en steek jou gesig daaragter weg.

SourceText: 👋 Then slowly pull it away and say, “Peekaboo!” with a big smile.
text: 👋 Haal dit stadig van jou gesig weg en sê, "Daar's hy!" met 'n groot glimlag.

SourceText: 🧸 Try hiding your baby’s favourite toy or your baby’s feet too. Each reveal is a surprise, sparking joy and curiosity!
text: 🧸 Probeer om ook jou baba se gunstelingspeelding of jou baba se voete weg te steek. Elke onthulling is 'n verrassing, wat vreugde en nuuskierigheid teweegbring!

SourceText: This playful activity encourages visual tracking, helps build anticipation, and supports early social interaction 👀
text: Hierdie prettige aktiwiteit moedig visuele navolging aan, dit help om afwagting te skep, en ondersteun vroeë sosiale interaksie 👀

SourceText: Peekaboo is more than just fun - it teaches your baby that things (and people!) still exist, even when they’re out of sight ✨
text: Koekeloer is meer as net pret - dit leer jou baba dat dinge (en mense) steeds bestaan, al is hulle ook buite sig ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ
text: Aangepas uit die UNICEF Playbox: https//www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ

SourceText: *Mirror Moments*
text: *Spieël-Oomblikke*

SourceText: It’s time to meet someone special - themselves! 👋
text: Dis tyd om iemand spesiaals te ontmoet - hom-/haarself! 👋

SourceText: 😃 Stand in front of a mirror or reflecting window with your little one and watch their reaction.
text: 😃 Staan voor die spieël of 'n weerkaatsende venster met jou klein ding en hou hul reaksie dop.

SourceText: 👀 You can point to their nose or eyes and name them aloud: “There’s your nose!”
text: 👀 Jy kan na hul neus of oë wys en dit hardop noem: "Daar's jou neus!"

SourceText: 🚩 For older babies, encourage them to touch the mirror or make faces. Smile, wave, and copy their movements!
text: 🚩 Moedig ouer babas aan om aan die spieël te raak of om gesigte te trek. Glimlag, waai en kopieer hul bewegings!

SourceText: Mirrors support self-awareness, recognition, and early language development - plus, they’re lots of fun! 💙
text: Spieëls ondersteun selfbewustheid, erkenning en vroeë taalontwikkeling - plus, dis baie pret! 💙

SourceText: *Texture Treasure Hunt*
text: *Tekstuur-Skattejag*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world through touch! 🌱
text: Kom ons verken die wêreld deur aanraking! 🌱

SourceText: ✅ Collect safe objects with different textures - like a soft sock, a wooden spoon, a smooth ball, or a crinkly wrapper.
text: ✅ Versamel veilige voorwerpe met verskillende teksture - soos 'n sagte sokkie, 'n houtlepel. 'n gladde bal, of gekreukelde papier.

SourceText: 👋 Gently guide your baby’s hands over each item and describe them: “Soft,” “Bumpy,” “Cold.”
text: 👋 Lei jou baba se hand saggies oor die item en beskryf dit: "sag," "hobbelrig," "koud".

SourceText: 🧸 Encourage older babies to choose what they want to touch. You can even let them sit in or next to a basket with the objects and explore freely.
text: 🧸 Moedig ouer babas aan om self te kies wat hulle wil aanraak. Jy kan hulle selfs in of langs die mandjie met die voorwerpe laat sit en vryelik verken.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps develop touch, language, and curiosity - and it’s perfect for quiet bonding time ⭐
text: Hierdie sensoriese aktiwiteit help om aanraking, taal en nuuskierigheid in jou kind te ontwikkel - en dis perfek om 'n nouer band met jou kind te vorm ⭐

SourceText: *Playtime with Books*
text: *Speeltyd met Boeke*

SourceText: Reading to your baby from birth is a beautiful way to bond and support their development - even before they understand the words 📖
text: Om voor geboorte al vir jou baba te lees, is 'n pragtige manier om 'n band te vorm en sy/haar ontwikkeling te ondersteun - selfs voordat hy/sy die woorde verstaan 📖

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a quiet moment, turn off distractions like TV and phones, and pick a baby-friendly book or even an old magazine or newspaper you have lying around!
text: ⏰ Kies 'n stil oomblik, skakel enige afleidings af, soos televisie en fone, kies 'n baba-vriendelike boek of selfs 'n ou tydskrif of koerant wat daar rondlê!

SourceText: 💚 Talk about the pictures, make sounds, and repeat simple words. Your baby will love hearing your voice - even if they don’t understand yet.
text: 💚 Praat oor die prentjies, maak geluide en herhaal eenvoudige woorde. Jou baba sal baie daarvan hou om jou stem te hoor - selfs al verstaan hy/sy nog nie.

SourceText: Follow their lead - if they lose interest, that’s okay. Keep it short and fun! 😃
text: Volg sy/haar leiding - as hy/sy belangstelling verloor, is dit oukei. Hou dit kort en prettig! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.Reading together for a few minutes a day is one of the best ways to help your child learn words and connect with you!
text: 🔄 Indien moontlik, begin jou gereelde roetine om saam te lees wanneer jou kind nie honger of moeg is nie.Om vir 'n paar minute op 'n dag saam te lees, is een van die beste maniere om jou kind te help om nuwe woorde te leer en 'n band met jou te vorm!

SourceText: *Act Out Emotions*
text: *Druk Emosies Uit*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun expressing feelings! 😃
text: Kom laat ons pret hê deur ons emosies uit te druk! 😃

SourceText: 👀 Tell your child, “Let’s see what it looks like when I am happy!”. Act out a happy face and name the emotion again.
text: 👀 Sê vir jou kind: "Kom ons kyk hoe dit lyk wanneer ons gelukkig is!" Maak 'n gelukkige gesig en noem weer die emosie.

SourceText: 😔 Then try other emotions, like angry, sad, or surprised. Using a gentle voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 😔 Probeer dan ander emosies soos kwaad, hartseer of verras. Jy kan in 'n sagte stemtoon verskillende redes verduidelik waarom jy daardie emosie voel.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Dit is nie net 'n speletjie nie - dis 'n geleentheid vir jou kind om te leer om emosies in ander te herken 💚

SourceText: By understanding facial expressions, they’ll strengthen their connections with others and develop empathy 💛
text: Deur gesigsuitdrukkings te verstaan, sal hy/sy sy/haar verbintenisse met ander versterk en empatie ontwikkel 💛

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: So, maak gereed om 'n paar emosies uit te druk en hierdie spesiale speelaktiwiteit saam te geniet! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from I am Safe, Loved, and Learning by Save the Children
text: Aangepas uit I am Safe, Loved, and Learning deur Save the Children

SourceText: *Animal Sounds & Moves*
text: *Dieregeluide & -bewegings*

SourceText: Let’s roar like a lion or flap like a bird! ⭐
text: Kom ons brul soos 'n leeu of flap soos 'n voel! ⭐

SourceText: 📖 Show your baby a soft animal toy or picture and say its name: “This is a lion - roooar!”
text: 📖 Wys vir jou baba 'n sagte dierespeelding of prentjie en sê sy naam: "Dit is 'n leeu - bruuuul!"

SourceText: 🌱 For younger babies, act it out during tummy time. Older babies might copy your sounds or movements.
text: 🌱 Doen dit vir jonger babas tydens magietyd. Ouer babas sal jou dalk naboots en die geluide of bewegings namaak.

SourceText: 👂 Talk to your baby as you play: “The cow says moo!” Pause and wait for their reaction, even a smile or babble.
text: 👂 Praat met jou baba terwyl julle speel: "Die koei sê moe!" Wag vir sy/haar reaksie, selfs 'n glimlag of gebabbel.

SourceText: This gentle game builds language, movement, and bonding – one animal at a time! 💛
text: Hierdie kalm speletjie bou taal, beweging en verbondenheid – een dier op 'n slag! 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal

SourceText: *Rolling Ball Fun*
text: *Pret met 'n Rollende Bal*

SourceText: Time for a rolling game! 🔵
text: Tyd vir 'n rolspeletjie! 🔵

SourceText: 👋 Sit facing your child and gently roll a soft ball (or something else round) back and forth between you. Say their name as you pass it: “Here it comes, Sisi!”
text: 👋 Sit teenoor jou kind en rol 'n sagte bal (of iets anders wat rond is) saggies heen en weer tussen julle. Sê sy/haar naam terwyl jy dit rol: "Hier kom dit, Sussie!"

SourceText: 💛 Cheer them on as they roll it back to you. You can even add a song or count the rolls out loud.
text: 💛 Moedig hom/haar aan terwyl hy/sy dit terugrol. Jy kan selfs 'n liedjie byvoeg of die aantal rolle aftel.

SourceText: This fun and easy game helps your toddler practise turn-taking, hand-eye coordination, and early social skills - all while enjoying playful connection 🎈
text: Hierdie prettige en maklike speletjie leer jou kleuter om sy/haar beurt af te wag, hand-oog-koördinasie, en vroeë sosiale vaardighede - alles terwyl julle dit speel-speel geniet en 'n band vorm🎈

SourceText: *Cup Stack Challenge*
text: *Koppiestapel-Uitdaging*

SourceText: 🍚 Grab some plastic cups or small containers and show your child how to stack them one by one.
text: 🍚 Gryp 'n paar plastiekkoppies of -houertjies en wys jou kind hoe om dit een vir een opmekaar te stapel.

SourceText: ⬆️ How high can you build your tower?
text: ⬆️ Hoe hoog kan jy jou toring bou?

SourceText: 🎉 Knocking it down is just as fun - watch it fall, then build again!
text: 🎉 Om dit om te gooi, is net soveel pret - kyk hoe dit val, en bou dit dan weer!

SourceText: This playful activity supports fine motor skills, concentration, and problem-solving - and your child will love seeing what happens each time they try 💡
text: Hierdie prettige speletjie ondersteun fyn motoriese vaardighede, konsentrasie en probleemoplossing - jou kind sal dit geniet om te sien wat elke keer gebeur wanneer julle probeer 💡

SourceText: *Dance Mirror*
text: * Spieëldans*

SourceText: Let’s get moving and dancing together! ⭐
text: Kom ons beweeg en dans saam! ⭐

SourceText: 👋 Turn on some music or sing a song, and start copying your child’s moves - if they clap, you clap! If they wiggle, you wiggle!
text: 👋 Sit bietjie musiek aan of sing 'n liedjie en begin om jou kind se bewegings na te boots - as hy/sy klap, klap jy ook! As hy/sy wikkel, wikkel jy ook!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and see if they’ll follow your moves.
text: 👀 Ruil dan om en kyk of hy/sy jou bewegings naboots.

SourceText: This back-and-forth dance helps build confidence, strengthens your bond, and supports early communication skills.
text: Hierdie heen-en-weer-dansery help om selfvertroue te bou, dit maak die band tussen julle sterker en ondersteun vroeë kommunikasievaardighede.

SourceText: It’s a joyful, silly way to connect through rhythm, music, and play 💚
text: Dis 'n vreugdevolle, lawwe manier om 'n band te vorm deur ritme, musiek en spel 💚

SourceText: *Guess the Animal*
text: * Raai Watter Dier*

SourceText: Let’s guess the animal! 🧸
text: Kom ons raai watter dier dit is! 🧸

SourceText: 👂 Make a sound like a cow (“moo!”) or a dog (“woof!”) and ask your child, “Which animal is that?”
text: 👂 Maak 'n geluid soos 'n koei ("moe") of 'n hond ("woef") en vra vir jou kind. "Watter dier is dit?"

SourceText: ⭐ You can point out animals you see, use toys, or just act it out yourself!
text: ⭐ Jy kan diere wat jy sien, uitwys, of speelgoed gebruik, of jy kan die diere self naboots!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and ask them to make the noise - you’ll be surprised how many they know.
text: 👀 Ruil dan om en vra hom/haar om die geluid te maak - jy sal verbaas wees hoeveel hy/sy ken.

SourceText: This fun game builds memory, language skills, and listening - all through the power of play and imagination ✅
text: Hierdie prettige speletjie bou geheue, taal- en luistervaardighede - alles deur die mag van spel en verbeelding ✅

SourceText: *Tap & Shake Band*
text: *Tik-en-Skud-Orkes*

SourceText: Get ready to make some noise! 🔔
text: Maak gereed om geraas te maak! 🔔

SourceText: 🍚 Gather safe household items - pots, plastic containers, spoons, or sealed bottles with rice or beans.
text: 🍚 Maak veilige huishoudelike items bymekaar - potte, plastiekhouers, lepels, of verseëlde bottels met rys of bone daarin.

SourceText: 👋Show your toddler how to tap, shake, and bang them together to create sounds.
text: 👋 Wys jou kleuter hoe om te tik, skud en dit teen mekaar te slaan om 'n geluid te maak.

SourceText: 🎵 Now, make some music and form your own little band! You can sing along or try repeating rhythms together.
text: 🎵 Maak nou musiek en begin julle eie orkessie! Julle kan saam sing of probeer om ritmes saam te herhaal.

SourceText: This activity builds motor skills, rhythm, and listening skills, and gives your toddler a chance to express themselves through sound and movement! ✨
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit bou motoriese vaardighede, ritme en luistervaardighede. Dit gee jou kleuter 'n geleentheid om hom-/haarself deur klank en beweging uit te druk! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY
text: Aangepas uit UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY

SourceText: *Where Did It Go*
text: *Waar Is Dit Heen?*

SourceText: Time for a little mystery! 🎁
text: Tyd vir 'n bietjie misterie! 🎁

SourceText: 🧸 Hide a small toy under a soft cloth or behind your back and ask, “Where did it go?”
text: 🧸 Steek 'n speeldingetjie onder 'n sagte lappie of agter jou rug weg en vra, "Waar is dit?"

SourceText: 👀 Watch your child pull the cloth away or crawl over to investigate.
text: 👀 Sien hoe jou kind die lappie aftrek of naderkruip om te ondersoek.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding and finding different objects together!
text: 🔄 Maak beurte om voorwerpe saam weg te steek en te vind!

SourceText: This game helps your toddler develop memory, curiosity, and helps them understand that things still exist even when they’re out of sight! 💡
text: Hierdie speletjie help jou kleuter met die ontwikkeling van geheue en nuuskierigheid, en help hom/haar om te verstaan dat goed steeds bestaan, al is dit ook buite sig! 💡

SourceText: *Lap Rhyme Bounce*
text: *Skootrympie-Hop*

SourceText: 🧸 Sit your baby gently on your lap and bounce them up and down while chanting a simple rhyme you remember from childhood.
text: 🧸 Plaas jou baba saggies op jou skoot en laat hom/haar op en af hop terwyl jy 'n eenvoudige rympie uit jou kinderjare sing.

SourceText: 😃You can speed up or slow down the bounce for extra fun. Add facial expressions or tickles for extra giggles!
text: 😃 Jy kan vinniger of stadiger hop vir ekstra pret. Voeg gesigsuitdrukkings of kielie by vir ekstra giggels!

SourceText: This rhythmic lap game builds bonding, listening, and body awareness - just like caregivers have done with little ones for generations 💙
text: Hierdie ritmiese skootspeletjie bou verbondenheid, luistervaardighede en maak hom/haar bewus van sy/haar liggaampie - net soos versorgers vir generasies met kinders gedoen het 💙

SourceText: *Shadow Play*
text: *Skaduspel*

SourceText: Step into a world of imagination and light with this exciting activity! 🌙
text: Stap 'n wêreld van verbeelding en lig binne met hierdie opwindende aktiwiteit🌙

SourceText: 💡 In a darkened room, grab a light and shine it at your hand, casting fun shadows onto the wall.
text: 💡 In 'n donker kamer, vat 'n lig en laat dit op jou hand skyn en maak prettige skaduwees teen die muur.

SourceText: 👋 Wave at your child and create silly shapes with your fingers - maybe a bunny, a bird, or whatever your imagination dreams up!
text: 👋 Waai vir jou kind en maak snaakse vorms met jou vingers - 'n hasie miskien, 'n voël, of wat ook al jou verbeelding kan opdroom!

SourceText: 👀 Watch as their curiosity grows, and invite them to try waving their shadow hand back.
text: 👀 Hou dop hoe sy/haar nuuskierigheid groei en vra hom/haar om terug te waai vir hul skaduhand.

SourceText: 🔑 Encourage your little one to take a turn with the flashlight, giving them the thrill of seeing how light can create different shapes and movements on the wall.
text: 🔑 Moedig jou kleinding aan om hierdie keer met die flits te speel, om die opwinding te ervaar en te sien hoe lig verskillende vorms en bewegings op die muur kan maak.

SourceText: 🏁 Older children might want to join in the fun and make a shadow animal of their own!
text: 🏁 Ouer kinders wil dalk ook deel in die pret om 'n skadudier van hul eie te maak!

SourceText: This practical experience helps them understand cause and effect, and boosts their creativity and focus as they make shadows ✅
text: Hierdie praktiese ervaring help hulle om oorsaak-en-gevolg te verstaan, en dit gee hul kreatiwiteit en fokus 'n hupstoot terwyl hulle skaduwees maak ✅

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/
text: Aangepas uit Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/

SourceText: *Mini Obstacle Race*
text: *Mini-Hinderniswedloop*

SourceText: Get ready to set up an exciting adventure right in your home! 🚩
text: Maak gereed vir 'n opwindende avontuur net daar in jou huis!🚩

SourceText: 🔶 Using pillows, chairs, and blankets, create a fun and safe obstacle race for your toddler to explore.
text: 🔶 Gebruik kussings, stoele en komberse om 'n prettige en veilige hinderniswedloop te maak wat jou kleuter kan verken.

SourceText: 👋 The goal? For your little one to navigate the course by crawling, jumping, and climbing over, under, and through the obstacles.
text: 👋 Die doel? Vir jou kleinding om die hindernisbaan te voltooi deur te kruip, spring, oor en onderdeur te klim en deur die hindernisse te gaan.

SourceText: 💡 As they tackle each challenge, they’ll be developing important gross motor skills like coordination, balance, and strength.
text: 💡 Soos hy/sy elke uitdaging aanpak, sal hy/sy belangrike groot motoriese vaardighede ontwikkel soos koördinasie, balans en krag.

SourceText: 💛Not only will this activity get them moving, but it will also boost their confidence as they conquer each part of the race.
text: 💛 Nie net sal hierdie aktiwiteit hom/haar laat beweeg nie, maar dit sal ook sy/haar selfvertroue 'n hupstoot gee, soos hy/sy elke deel van die reis voltooi.

SourceText: It’s an easy, playful way to promote physical development while having a great time together! Let the obstacle adventure begin! 🎉
text: Dis 'n maklike, prettige manier om fisiese ontwikkeling aan te moedig, terwyl julle 'n lekker tyd saam geniet! Laat die hindernis-avontuur begin! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/
text: Aangepas uit Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/

SourceText: *Categorising and Organising*
text: *Kategoriseer en Organiseer*

SourceText: Help your child to learn by sorting objects and things! 🔵🔷
text: Help jou kind om te leer deur voorwerpe te sorteer! 🔵🔷

SourceText: By grouping items like a bear as an animal or a mango as a fruit, they’ll start to understand how different things fit together. 🧸
text: Deur items te groepeer, byvoorbeeld 'n beer as 'n dier, of 'n mango as 'n vrug, sal kinders begin verstaan hoe verskillende goed by mekaar pas. 🧸

SourceText: At home, find safe objects and let them sort them by colour, size, or type - plastic cups and plates are perfect for this!
text: Vind veilige voorwerpe in die huis en laat hulle dit volgens kleur, grootte of tipes sorteer - plastiekkoppies en -pierings is perfek hiervoor!

SourceText: Want to make it more interesting? Try sorting pots and pans by size: Can they fit the small pans into the larger ones? ☕
text: Wil jy dit interessanter maak? Probeer om potte en panne volgens grootte te sorteer: Kan hy/sy die klein pannetjies in die groter een pas?☕

SourceText: If you are outside, name different kinds of vehicles on the street or things you see in nature like stones, sticks, trees and flowers. 🌷
text: As julle buite is, noem verskillende soorte voertuie in die straat, of goed wat jy in die natuur sien, soos klippe, bome en blomme. 🌷

SourceText: 🔄 You can play the categorising game anywhere! Just look around and ask your child to find things from the category you say!
text: 🔄 Jy kan enige plek die kategoriseringspeletjie speel! Kyk rond en vra jou kind om goed te vind van die kategorie wat jy noem!

SourceText: Sorting and grouping builds thinking skills, memory, and early logic -helping your child make sense of the world around them through playful discovery 🌈
text: Sortering en groepering bou denkvaardighede, geheue en vroeë logika - dit help jou kind om sin te maak van die wêreld rondom hom/haar deur speelse ontdekking 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/
text: Aangepas uit Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/

SourceText: *Shapes Everywhere!*
text: *Vorms Waar jy Kyk!*

SourceText: 📺 Squares, squares everywhere
text: 📺 Vierkante, vierkante waar jy kyk

SourceText: 👀 Draw squares in the sand or dirt. Make some bigger and some smaller.
text: 👀 Teken vierkante in die sand of grond. Maak party groter en ander kleiner.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname, “this is a square.”
text: Sê vir @fields.child_nickname, "dit is 'n vierkant".
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask your child to try to draw a square. Hold your child’s hand to help if this is hard.
text: Vra vir jou kind om 'n vierkant te teken. Hou jou kind se hand vas om te help indien dit moeilik is.

SourceText: Look for things around the home or outdoors that are the same shape.
text: Kyk in die huis of buite vir goed wat dieselfde vorm het.

SourceText: Now do the same with circles! 🔴
text: Doen nou dieselfde met sirkels! 🔴

SourceText: Tell your child, “this is a square.”
text: Sê vir jou kind, "dit is 'n vierkant".

SourceText: This simple shape game builds early maths skills, observation, and coordination - right from the start! ✅
text: Hierdie eenvoudige vormspel bou vroeë wiskundige vaardighede, waarneming en koördinasie - reg van die begin af! ✅

SourceText: *Active Songs*
text: *Aktiewe Liedjies*

SourceText: Young children love to move - and songs with actions make it even more fun! Singing gives your child cues for how and when to move 🎵
text: Jong kinders hou daarvan om te beweeg - liedjies met aksies maak dit meer pret! Sang gee jou kind tekens vir hoe en wanneer om te beweeg🎵

SourceText: Movement songs build listening skills, self-control, and rhythm - while helping your child learn to follow instructions!
text: Bewegingsliedjies bou luistervaardighede, selfvertroue en ritme - terwyl jou kind leer om instruksies te volg!

SourceText: Sing songs to @fields.child_nickname or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Sing liedjies saam met @fields.child_nickname of 'n groep kinders waar hulle moet:
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✅ Start and stop ❌
text: ✅ Begin en stop ❌

SourceText: ⬇️ Slow down and speed up ⬆️
text: ⬇️ Stadiger en vinniger moet beweeg ⬆️

SourceText: Some song ideas:- “If you’re happy and you know it”- “Heads, shoulders, knees and toes”- “Freeze dance” (play or sing music and freeze when it stops!)- “Sleeping bunnies” (sleep, then hop!)
text: 'n Paar liedjie-idees: - "If you're happy and you know it"- "Kop, skouers, knieë en tone"- "Vriesdans" (speel of sing liedjies en vries wanneer dit stop!)- "Slapende hasies"(slaap, dan hop!)

SourceText: Sing songs to your child or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Sing liedjies vir jou kinders of 'n groep kinders, waar hulle moet:

SourceText: *Be the Narrator*
text: *Wees die Verteller*

SourceText: 👀 Say what your child is doing while they are playing.
text: 👀 Sê wat jou kind besig is om te doen terwyl hy/sy speel.

SourceText: 👂 This will help them learn the words to describe their actions.
text: 👂 Dit sal hulle help om die woorde te leer wat hulle aksies beskryf.

SourceText: 😃 You can do it in a simple way, or in a silly way like a sports commentator, a news presenter, or a game show host.
text: 😃 Jy kan dit op 'n eenvoudige manier doen, of maak of jy 'n sportkommentator is, 'n nuusaanbieder of 'n speletjiesprogramaanbieder.

SourceText: 💡 Ask questions like “What will you do next?” or “I see you want to put the ball in the jar. Is there another way to do that?”
text: 💡 Vra vrae soos "Wat gaan jy volgende doen?" of "Ek sien jy wil die bal in die pot sit. Is daar n ander manier om dit te doen?"

SourceText: *Be an Artist!*
text: *Wees 'n Kunstenaar!*

SourceText: 📝 Give @fields.child_nickname some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝 Gee vir @fields.child_nickname papier en 'n pen of potlood, of 'n paar verskillende penne of potlode.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 😃 Let your child draw whatever they want to!
text: 😃 Laat jou kind teken net wat hy/sy wil!

SourceText: 👀 Ask questions about what they are drawing, the size of the thing they are drawing, and the colours they are using.
text: 👀 Vra vrae oor wat hulle teken, die grootte van die ding wat hulle teken, en die kleure wat hulle gebruik.

SourceText: 🏆 If possible, put your child’s picture up on the wall when they are finished. Give praise to your child!
text: 🏆 Indien moontlik, sit jou kind se prentjie teen die muur wanneer hy/sy klaar is. Prys jou kind!

SourceText: 📝 Give your child some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝 Gee vir jou kind papier en 'n pen of potlood, of 'n paar verskillende penne of potlode.

SourceText: This open drawing time builds imagination, fine motor skills, and confidence - especially when you celebrate their creations! 🎉
text: Hierdie ope tekentyd bou verbeelding, fyn motoriese vaardighede en selfvertroue - veral wanneer jy sy/haar ontwerpe vier! 🎉

SourceText: *Echo Songs*
text: *Eggoliedjies*

SourceText: 😃 Try a simple call-and-response chant with your child. You say a line, and they copy it back.
text: 😃 Probeer 'n eenvoudige roep-en-reageerliedjie met jou kind. Jy sê 'n reël, en jou kind sê dit terug.

SourceText: 👂 For example:
text: 👂 Byvoorbeeld:

SourceText: You: “Hello there!”
text: Jy: "Hallo daar!"

SourceText: Child: “Hello there!”
text: Kind: "Hallo daar!"

SourceText: You: “How are you?”
text: Jy: "Hoe gaan dit?"

SourceText: Child: “How are you?”
text: Kind: "Hoe gaan dit?"

SourceText: 💚 Use your own words and language.
text: 💚 Gebruik jou eie woorde en taal.

SourceText: These traditional-style echo songs build turn-taking, memory, and early conversation skills - all through playful singing 🎵
text: Hierdie tradisionele styl eggoliedjies bou beurtneming, geheue en vroeë gesprekvoeringsvaardighede - alles deur prettig te sing 🎵

SourceText: *Circle Clap and Dance*
text: *Klap en Dans in 'n Sirkel*

SourceText: 👋 Gather a few children (or just you and your little one) and form a small circle.
text: 👋 Kry 'n paar kinders bymekaar (of net jy en jou kind) en vorm 'n klein sirkel.

SourceText: 🎵 Clap your hands in rhythm and sing a well-known local song like: “Shosholoza… ku lezontaba…”
text: 🎵 Klap julle hande in ritme en sing 'n welbekende plaaslike liedjie soos: "Shosholoza … ku lezontaba…”

SourceText: ⭐ As the song plays, take turns dancing into the centre of the circle or copying each other’s moves. Children can jump, spin, or stomp to the beat!
text: ⭐ Terwyl die liedjie speel, maak beurte om in die middel van die sirkel te dans of maak dieselfde bewegings wat die ander een maak. Kinders kan spring, draai en hulle voete op die ritme stamp!

SourceText: This joyful game builds social confidence, movement skills, and musical rhythm - all while connecting to culture 💛
text: Hierdie jolige speletjie bou sosiale selfvertroue, bewegingsvaardighede en musikale ritme - alles terwyl hy/sy inskakel by 'n kultuur💛

SourceText: *One-on-One Time*
text: *Een-tot-Een Tyd*

SourceText: 💚 Spending time just with your child and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship.
text: 💚 Om tyd met jou kind te spandeer en belangstelling in hom/haar te toon, kan julle verhouding verbeter.

SourceText: 👀 When your child is playing alone or occupying themselves quietly, join them and show interest in what they are doing.
text: 👀 Wanneer jou kind alleen speel of hom-/haarself stilletjies besig hou, sluit by hom/haar aan en wys belangstelling in wat hy/sy doen.

SourceText: 👂Ask questions about their activity, and listen to them.
text: 👂Vra vrae oor hulle aktiwiteit, en luister na hulle.

SourceText: Let your child lead the activity, follow them to build their confidence and autonomy 😃.
text: Laat jou kind die aktiwiteit lei, volg hom/haar om sy/haar selfvertroue en individualiteit te bou 😀.

SourceText: 👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your child’s actions.
text: 👀 Sê wat jy sien - beskryf alles en ondersteun jou kind se aksies.

SourceText: Be positive, praise your child, and enjoy spending this time with them 😃💚
text: Wees positief, prys jou kind en geniet die tyd saam met hom/haar😀💚

SourceText: 📖 Book sharing will help your child learn and is a fun, playful activity to spend quality time together.
text: 📖 Saamlees sal jou kind help om te leer, en dis 'n prettige speelaktiwiteit om kwaliteittyd saam te spandeer.

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a time when you won’t be disturbed, and try to stop any distractions - e.g. turn off the TV and put away phones.
text: ⏰ Kies 'n tyd wanneer julle nie onderbreek sal word nie, en probeer om enige afleidings te stop - bv. skakel die TV af en bêre alle fone.

SourceText: 📖 If your child wants to choose a book, that’s fine, otherwise choose for them.
text: 📖 As jou kind 'n boekie wil kies, is dit reg, andersins kies jy vir hom/haar.

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child’s attention and lead.
text: 💚 Sit na aan mekaar en volg jou kind se aandag en leiding.

SourceText: Point at things, name and repeat words. Help them to learn more about what interests them in the book 👀
text: Wys na dinge, benoem dit en herhaal woorde. Help hulle om meer te leer oor dit wat hulle interesseer in die boek 👀

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃
text: Verbind dinge in die boeke aan jou kind se lewe, en gebruik woorde oor emosies en praat daaroor! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.
text: 🔄 Indien moontlik, begin 'n gereelde roetine om saam te lees, wanneer jou kind nie te moeg of honger is nie.

SourceText: Reading together is one of the best ways to help your child learn and prepare for success in school! 🎓
text: Om saam te lees is een van die beste maniere om jou kind te help leer en voor te berei vir sukses in die skool! 🎓

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child's attention and lead.
text: 💚 Sit na aan mekaar en volg jou kind se aandag en leiding.

SourceText: If there are words or numbers in the book, ask and help your child recognise letters numbers, and simple words 💡.
text: As daar woorde of getalle in die boek is, vra jou kind en help hom/haar om letters, getalle en eenvoudige woorde te herken 💡

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃.
text: Verbind dinge in die boeke aan jou kind se lewe, en gebruik woorde oor emosies en praat daaroor! 😃.

SourceText: *Animal Acting*
text: * Diere-Aksie*

SourceText: Get ready to roar like a lion or hop like a kangaroo! 🧸
text: Maak gereed om soos 'n leeu te brul of soos 'n kangaroe te hop! 🧸

SourceText: 📝 To start, write the names of animals on small pieces of paper and put them in a box or container.
text: 📝 Om te begin, skryf die name van die diere op 'n stukkie papier en sit dit in 'n leë houer.

SourceText: 👋 Take turns picking a piece of paper and acting out the animal - can you mimic its sounds and movements? Roar, jump, crawl, or fly just like the animal you picked!
text: 👋 Maak beurte om 'n stukkie papier uit te haal en te reageer soos die spesifieke dier - kan jy die geluide en bewegings naboots? Brul, spring, kruip of vlieg soos die dier wat jy gekies het!

SourceText: 🎉 For older kids, turn it into a fun guessing game - see if others can guess which animal you’re pretending to be!
text: 🎉 Vir ouer kinders, verander dit in 'n prettige raai-raai-speletjie - kyk of hulle kan raai watter dier jy namaak!

SourceText: This active game helps kids develop physical skills while also supporting speech and language development in a fun way 💚
text: Hierdie aktiewe speletjie help om kinders fisies te ontwikkel, terwyl hulle spraak en taal op 'n prettige manier ontwikkel word 💚

SourceText: *Freeze Dance*
text: *Vriesdans*

SourceText: Get ready to dance and freeze with this exciting activity that toddlers love! 🎵
text: Maak gereed om te dans en te vries met hierdie opwindende aktiwiteit waarvan kleuters baie hou! 🎵

SourceText: 📻 Play some music and let your child dance or move however they like.
text: 📻 Speel musiek en laat jou kind dans en beweeg net soos hy/sy wil.

SourceText: ⏸ When the music stops, tell them to freeze – to not move at all! – in one place.
text: ⏸ Wanneer die musiek stop, sê vir hom/haar om te vries - om glad nie te beweeg nie - op een plek.

SourceText: This fun game is great for building listening skills and self-control as they practise stopping and starting ✨
text: Hierdie prettige speletjie help met jou kind se luistervaardighede en selfbeheersing, soos hy/sy oefen om te stop en weer te begin ✨

SourceText: It’s also a wonderful way to prepare for school, where they’ll need to follow directions 🔑
text: Dis ook 'n goeie manier om hom/haar voor te berei vir skool, waar hy/sy aanwysings moet volg 🔑

SourceText: So, turn up the music and enjoy the dancing – and the freezing! 💚
text: So, sit die musiek harder en geniet die dans - en die vries! 💚

SourceText: *Mystery Bag*
text: *Raaiselsak*

SourceText: This game is easy and perfect for engaging your toddler’s senses and learning new words 🎁
text: Hierdie speletjie is maklik en perfek om jou kleuter se sintuie te betrek en om nuwe woorde te leer 🎁

SourceText: 🏆 Simply place different objects into a bag and ask your child to reach in, feel an item, and guess what it is before pulling it out.
text: 🏆 Plaas verskillende voorwerpe in 'n sak en vra jou kind om 'n item te voel en te raai wat dit is voordat hy/sy dit uithaal.

SourceText: 👋 When they pull out the item, ask them questions to describe what they see: Is it smooth or scary? Bumpy or bright?
text: 👋 Wanneer hy/sy die item uithaal, vra vir hom/haar vrae om te beskryf wat hy/sy sien: Is dit glad of grillerig? Hobbelrig of helder?

SourceText: It’s a fun way to introduce new words and stimulate their sense of touch! 💡
text: Dis 'n prettige manier om nuwe woorde bekend te stel en sy/haar tassintuig te stimuleer! 💡

SourceText: Benefits of this activity include expanding vocabulary, developing tactile senses, and practising grouping skills. It’s a wonderful way to mix fun with learning! 🎉
text: Voordele van hierdie aktiwiteit sluit die uitbreiding van sy/haar woordeskat in, asook ontwikkeling van die tassintuig en om groeperingsvaardighede te oefen. Dis 'n wonderlike manier om pret met leer te meng! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game
text: Aangepas uit British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game

SourceText: *Body Outline*
text: *Buitelyn van die Liggaam*

SourceText: This fun and interactive game helps your toddler learn about different parts of the body 🧸
text: Hierdie prettige interaktiewe speletjie help jou kleuter leer van die verskillende dele van die liggaam 🧸

SourceText: 📝 Start by drawing their body outline on a large piece of paper or with a stick on the ground.
text: 📝 Begin deur die buitelyn van sy/haar liggaam op 'n groot stuk papier te teken, of met 'n stok op die grond.

SourceText: 👂 As you go, ask them to point to and name different body parts. For example, you can say, “Where’s your nose?” or “Can you point to your feet?”
text: 👂 Soos jy aangaan, vra hom/haar om die verskillende liggaamsdele te wys en te noem. Jy kan byvoorbeeld sê, "Waar is jou neus?" of "Kan jy na sy voete wys?"

SourceText: 👋As they point, encourage them to name each part.
text: 👋 Soos hy/sy wys, moedig hom/haar aan om elke deel te noem.

SourceText: 🎨 When you are done, you can colour in the outline or decorate it with anything you have in or around the house to make it more creative and engaging!
text: 🎨 Wanneer julle klaar is, kan julle die buitelyn inkleur of versier met enigiets wat julle in of rondom die huis het om dit meer kreatief te maak!

SourceText: This fun and creative activity helps your child improve their body awareness, learn new words, and develop fine motor skills 💡
text: Hierdie prettige en kreatiewe aktiwiteit help jou kind om die bewustheid van sy/haar liggaam te verbeter, nuwe woorde te leer en fyn motoriese vaardighede te ontwikkel 💡

SourceText: *Paper Ball Game*
text: *Papierbal-Speletjie*

SourceText: Get ready to practice your child’s aim and physical coordination as you play with paper balls together 🔷
text: Maak gereed om jou kind se akkuraatheidsvernuf en fisiese koördinasie te oefen terwyl julle saam met die papierballe speel 🔷

SourceText: 📝 Here’s what you’ll need: paper (to scrunch up into balls), and crayons.
text: 📝 Hier is wat jy sal benodig: papier (om in balle op te frommel) en kryt.

SourceText: 🎨 Start by colouring each piece of paper so that it is a unique colour. Now scrunch up the paper until you have a paper ball.
text: 🎨 Begin deur elke deel van die papier in te kleur sodat dit 'n unieke kleur is. Frommel nou die papier op tot jy 'n papierbal het.

SourceText: 🚩 Next, make a goal. You can use markings that already exist, or a clear table surface.
text: 🚩 Volgende, maak 'n doel. Gebruik merke wat alreeds bestaan, of gebruik 'n skoon oppervlak.

SourceText: 🏅 Now you’re ready to play! Take turns tossing your ball towards the goal. Whoever scores or lands closest to the goal wins the round!
text: 🏅 Nou is jy gereed om te speel! Maak beurte om die bal na die doel te gooi. Wie ook al die papierbal die naaste aan die doel plaas, wen die rondte!

SourceText: This fun and engaging game is perfect for boosting your child’s physical coordination and decision-making skills while keeping them entertained. Let the friendly competition begin! ⭐
text: Hierdie prettige interaktiewe speletjie is perfek om jou kind se fisiese koördinasie en besluitnemingsvaardighede te verbeter terwyl hy/sy vermaak word. Laat die vriendskaplike kompetisie begin!⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps

SourceText: *Letter in the Shop*
text: *Briefie in die Winkel*

SourceText: Turn your next trip to the store into a learning adventure! 🍞
text: Omskep jou volgende uitstappie na die winkel in 'n leeravontuur! 🍞

SourceText: 🍅 As you shop, pick a letter and talk about the items on your shopping list that start with that letter.
text: 🍅 Terwyl julle inkopies doen, kies 'n letter en praat oor die item op jou inkopielys wat met dieselfde letter begin.

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to find other things in the shop that start with the same letter.
text: 👀 Vra jou kind om nog items wat met dieselfde letter begin, in die winkel te vind.

SourceText: This simple activity helps build your child’s letter recognition and vocabulary while keeping them engaged during the shopping trip ✨
text: Hierdie eenvoudige aktiwiteit help om jou kind se letterherkenning en woordeskat te bou terwyl jy hom/haar betrokke maak by die inkopie-uitstappie ✨

SourceText: It’s a fun, interactive way to learn about letters and sounds in real-world situations, turning an ordinary task into an exciting educational game! 🌈
text: Dis 'n prettige interaktiewe manier om in die regte wêreld oor letters en geluide te leer deur 'n eenvoudige taak in 'n opwindende opvoedkundige speletjie te omskep! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/
text: Aangepas uit Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/

SourceText: *Fun with Food*
text: *Pret met Kos*

SourceText: Cooking can help your child start learning maths!
text: Kosmaak kan jou kind help om wiskunde te leer!

SourceText: 💚 Invite your child to help you cook for your family, or to help you prepare a colourful fruit salad.
text: 💚 Nooi jou kind om jou te help om vir die gesin te kook, of om jou te help om 'n kleurvolle vrugteslaai voor te berei.

SourceText: 🍅 As you gather the ingredients, ask them to count: 'How many tomatoes do we have?' This builds maths skills and encourages teamwork.
text: 🍅 Soos jy die bestanddele bymekaar maak, vra jou kind om dit te tel: "Hoeveel tamaties is daar?" Dit bou wiskundige vaardighede en moedig spanwerk aan.

SourceText: 5️⃣ Help your child to understand adding and subtracting quantities. 'We need five tomatoes, if we have three, how many more do we need?' This makes learning fun!
text: 5️⃣ Help jou kind om optel en aftrek van hoeveelhede te verstaan. "Ons het vyf tamaties nodig. As ons drie het, hoeveel het ons nog nodig?" Dit maak leer pret!

SourceText: 👀 Let’s make it playful! Ask, 'Which is bigger: the tomato or the onion?' This reinforces comparison skills.
text: 👀 Kom ons maak dit speel-speel! "Wat is die grootste, die tamatie of die ui?" Dit versterk vergelykingsvaardighede.

SourceText: 🔄 Consider planning a weekly cooking night.
text: 🔄 Oorweeg dit om 'n weeklikse kookaand te beplan.

SourceText: Cooking strengthens your relationship and builds your child’s confidence. Enjoy your cooking adventure together!
text: Om saam te kook, maak jul verhouding sterker en dit bou die kind se selfvertroue. Geniet julle kookavonture saam!

SourceText: Adapted from Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/
text: Aangepas uit Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/

SourceText: *Following Instructions*
text: *Volg Instruksies*

SourceText: 👂 Play a game in which your child listens to and tries to remember strings of instructions.
text: 👂 Speel 'n speletjie waar jou kind luister en probeer om veelvuldige instruksies te onthou.

SourceText: This will be useful in school, at home, and later in life!
text: Dit sal op skool, tuis, en later in die lewe handig te pas kom!

SourceText: Start with just one instruction using an object in your home. For example “touch the red ball” 🔴
text: Begin met slegs een instruksie deur 'n voorwerp in julle huis te gebruik, byvoorbeeld “raak aan die rooi bal”. 🔴

SourceText: Slowly add more instructions (e.g “then pick up the cup "☕), but tell your child that they can only start once you’ve finished giving the instructions.
text: Voeg meer instruksies geleidelik by (bv. "tel dan die koppie op"☕), maar sê vir jou kind dat hy/sy slegs kan begin nadat jy die instruksies gegee het.

SourceText: See how many your child can follow without forgetting!
text: Kyk hoeveel instruksies jou kind kan volg sonder om te vergeet!

SourceText: 🔄 Now swap roles! It’s your child’s turn to give you instructions! They can use the same objects if they want.
text: 🔄 Ruil nou rolle om! Dis jou kind se beurt om vir jou instruksies te gee! Hy/sy kan dieselfde voorwerpe gebruik as hy/sy wil.

SourceText: You can also try this game with a group of children! Make sure they take turns 😃
text: Jy kan ook hierdie speletjie met 'n groep kinders probeer! Maak seker dat hulle beurte maak 😃

SourceText: *I Spy Colours!*
text: * Ek Sien Kleure!*

SourceText: 👀 Choose an object around you and say: “I spy with my little eye, something that is…” and say the colour of object, like “yellow” or “red”.
text: 👀 Kies 'n voorwerp naby jou en sê: "Ek sien met my kleine ogie, iets wat ... is." Sê die kleur van die voorwerp, soos "geel" of "rooi".

SourceText: ✅ Encourage your child to look around and guess what the object might be. When they guess correctly, give them praise and switch roles!
text: ✅ Moedig jou kind aan om rond te kyk en te raai wat die voorwerp kan wees. Wanneer hy/sy reg raai, prys hom/haar en ruil rolle om!

SourceText: 🔑 If they’re having trouble, offer clues like, “It’s round” or “It’s somewhere in that corner".
text: 🔑 As hy/sy dit moeilik vind, gee leidrade soos "dis rond" of "dis iewers in daardie hoek".

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the game going with new objects and different colours.
text: 🔄 Hou aan met die speletjie deur nuwe voorwerpe en verskillende kleure te gebruik.

SourceText: This classic game is a fun and interactive way to help your child learn words, observe, and stay concentrated. This will help them at home and in school 🏁
text: Hierdie klassieke speletjie is 'n prettige en interaktiewe manier om jou kind woorde, waarneming en konsentrasie te leer. Dit sal hom/haar by die huis en by die skool help 🏁

SourceText: *I Spy Letters!*
text: *Ek Sien Letters!*

SourceText: 👀 I spy is a fun game to play with your child that will help them learn about letters and words!
text: 👀 "Ek sien" is 'n lekker speletjie om met jou kind te speel, en dit help hom/haar om letters en woorde te leer!

SourceText: Choose an object or a thing around you, and don’t tell your child what it is. It should be something that your child knows the word for. For example “ball” ⚽
text: Kies 'n voorwerp of iets naby jou, en moenie vir jou kind sê wat dit is nie. Dit moet 'n eenvoudige voorwerp wees wat jou kind ken, bv. "bal" ⚽

SourceText: 👀 Then say “I spy with my little eye, something beginning with *and then say the first letter of the word* which in this case is “b”
text: 👀 Sê dan “Ek sien met my kleine ogie, iets wat begin met *en sê dan die eerste letter van die woord,* wat in hierdie geval “b” is

SourceText: Your child should look around and guess what the object is. When they guess it right, praise them and swap roles! If they can’t get it, give them some clues, like “it’s round” or “it’s black and white”. ✅
text: Jou kind moet rondkyk en raai wat die voorwerp is. Wanneer hy/sy reg raai, prys hom/haar en ruil rolle om. As hy/sy nie dit nie regkry nie, gee leidrade soos "dis rond" of "dis wit en swart". ✅

SourceText: Play this game with as many objects as possible and as many different letters! Help your child to learn about the different letters and sounds in words. This will help them learn to read at home and school. 🎓
text: Speel hierdie speletjie met soveel voorwerpe as moontlik en baie verskillende letters! Help jou kind om van die verskillende letters en klanke in woorde te leer. Dit sal hom/haar by die huis en by die skool help om te leer lees. 🎓

SourceText: *What Letter is This?*
text: *Watter Letter is Dit?*

SourceText: Playing games with letters can help your child learn the alphabet and how letters are put together to make words.
text: Speletjies met letters kan jou kind help om die alfabet te leer en hoe letters bymekaargesit word om woorde te vorm.

SourceText: 📝 Write a letter on a piece of card or paper (e.g. “p”)
text: 📝 Skryf 'n letter op 'n stukkie karton of papier (bv. “p”)

SourceText: 👂 Say the letter out loud and ask your child to say it too!
text: 👂 Sê die letter hardop en vra jou kind om dit ook te sê!

SourceText: Ask your child to say some words that begin with the letter “p”, give them clues like “What starts with “p”? Plant… What else? 🌱
text: Vra jou kind om 'n paar woorde te noem wat met die letter "p" begin; gee vir hom/haar leidrade soos "Wat begin met P?" Plant ... Wat nog? 🌱

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to look for objects in your house that begin with a letter (eg “p” for plate). Help them find things.
text: 👀 Vra vir jou kind om voorwerpe in die huis te soek wat met 'n sekere letter begin (bv. "b" vir bord). Help hom/haar om die goed te vind.

SourceText: 🔄 Try a new letter every day!
text: 🔄 Probeer elke dag 'n nuwe letter!

SourceText: *Riddles Time*
text: *Raaiseltyd*

SourceText: Riddles and puzzles are a fun way to build thinking skills! 💡
text: Raaisels en kopkrappers is 'n prettige manier om denkvaardighede te ontwikkel! 💡

SourceText: Do you remember any riddles from your childhood? If you can’t then make one up, they can be very simple! 😃
text: Onthou jy enige raaisels uit jou kinderdae? As jy nie kan nie, dink dan een uit, dit kan baie eenvoudig wees! 😃

SourceText: Like “What can you see at night but not in the day” Answer: “The moon” 🌙
text: Soos “Wat kan jy in die nag sien, maar nie in die dag nie?” Antwoord: “Die maan” 🌙

SourceText: If your child is finding them difficult, try an easy one like: “What is round, bouncy and can be thrown or kicked?” Answer: “A ball” ⚽
text: As jou kind dit moeilik vind, probeer 'n makliker een soos: "Wat is rond, hop en kan gegooi of geskop word?" Antwoord: "'n Bal" ⚽

SourceText: Your child can also try making riddles! 💡
text: Jou kind kan ook probeer om self raaisels te maak! 💡

SourceText: You can have fun with riddles anywhere at any time - like traveling on a bus, walking to school or in a car 🚗
text: Julle kan enige plek, enige tyd, pret met raaisels hê - soos terwyl julle in 'n bus ry, skool toe stap of in 'n motor ry 🚗

SourceText: *Make up a Story*
text: *Dink 'n Storie uit*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your child’s creativity! 📖
text: Om stories te skep, is 'n goeie manier om pret met verbeelding te hê - en om jou kind se kreatiwiteit te ontwikkel! 📖

SourceText: 5️⃣ With your child, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your child.
text: 5️⃣ Dink, saam met jou kind, aan 5 woorde om te gebruik. Dit kan enige woorde wees! Byvoorbeeld: piesang, ruimteskip, vis, water, skildery, kook, troue. As julle dit moet onthou, skryf dit duidelik op 'n stukkie papier saam met jou kind neer.

SourceText: 🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”
text: 🎂 Begin julle storie met “Eendag, lank, lank gelede was daar 'n …” en gebruik een van die woorde uit die lys in die eerste deel. Byvoorbeeld, “Eendag, lank, lank gelede was daar 'n gesin wat op 'n *piesang*-plaas gewerk het.”

SourceText: 📝 Let your child make up the next part using another word from the list.
text: 📝 Laat jou kind die volgende gedeelte doen, deur 'n ander woord op die lys te gebruik.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story.
text: 🔄 Neem beurte totdat julle al die woorde gebruik het en 'n storie geskep het.

SourceText: 🔔 Be creative and do not tell your child what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!
text: 🔔 Wees kreatief en moenie vir jou kind sê wat om te sê nie. Dit het nie nodig om 'n ware storie te wees om pret te wees nie!

SourceText: 🎁 Ask your child what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: 🎁 Vra wat sy/haar gunstelingdeel van die storie was en noem ook jou gunstelingdeel!

SourceText: *Playing with Clothes*
text: *Speel met Klere*

SourceText: 💡 Clothes can be the perfect ‘toys’ to help your child build fine motor skills, recognise colours, and think! Here are 3 ideas you can try:
text: 💡 Klere kan die perfekte speelgoed wees om fyn motoriese vaardighede te bou, kleure te herken en te dink! Hier is 3 idees wat jy kan probeer:

SourceText: 👋 Practice
text: 👋 Oefen

SourceText: Help your child exercise their fingers by showing them how buttons and zips work on clothes, and letting them practise using them!
text: Help jou kind om sy/haar vingers te oefen deur te wys hoe knope en ritssluiters aan klere werk en laat hy/sy oefen om dit te gebruik!

SourceText: 🔵 Colours
text: 🔵 Kleure

SourceText: Talk about the colours of clothes! Ask your child to name the colours of their clothes and talk about all the things that are that colour: “What are all the things we can think of that are blue?”
text: Gesels oor die kleure van klere! Vra vir jou kind om die kleure van sy/haar klere te noem en praat oor goed wat daardie kleur is: "Aan watter goed kan ons alles dink wat blou is?"

SourceText: 🔶 Sorting
text: 🔶 Sortering

SourceText: When you have done laundry, ask your child to help you sort clothes into piles for each family member.
text: Wanneer jy wasgoed gewas het, vra jou kind om jou te help om die wasgoed uit te sorteer, met 'n hoop vir elke gesinslid.

SourceText: *Playing with Vegetables*
text: *Speel met Groente*

SourceText: 🌱 Help your child learn by thinking and talking about vegetables! Here are 3 ideas for you:
text: 🌱 Help jou kind om te leer deur te dink en te praat oor groente! Hier is 3 idees vir jou:

SourceText: 🍅 Sorting vegetablesMix together 2-3 different ingredients of your choice (like onions, tomatoes and corn example). Say: “Help me sort these vegetables into piles?” Try sorting them by size.
text: 🍅 Sortering van groenteMeng 2-3 verskillende bestanddele van jou keuse saam (soos byvoorbeeld uie, tamaties en mielies). Sê: "Kom ons sorteer hierdie groente in hopies." Probeer om hulle volgens grootte te sorteer.

SourceText: 😃 Remind me!
text: 😃 Herinner my!

SourceText: Talk about your child’s experiences. Ask questions and wait for answers. Follow your child’s interests.
text: Praat oor jou kind se ervarings. Vra vrae en wag vir antwoorde. Volg jou kind se belangstellings.

SourceText: “Can you help me remember what is at the market?” “Do they sell carrots at the market?” “Do they sell anything yellow at the market?” “What else do they sell?”
text: "Kan jy my help om te onthou wat by die mark is?" "Verkoop hulle wortels by die mark?" "Verkoop hulle enige geel goed by die mark?" "Wat verkoop hulle nog?"

SourceText: 💡 Something similar
text: 💡 Iets Soortgelyks

SourceText: Say: We are going to think of some things that are similar or different from what I tell you. So listen carefully!”
text: Sê: "Ons gaan dink aan goed wat dieselfde of verskillend is van wat ek vir jou sê. So luister mooi!”

SourceText: Here is a tomato. Can you think of something else that is red like a tomato? 🍅
text: Hier is 'n tamatie. Kan jy aan nog iets dink wat rooi is soos 'n tamatie? 🍅

SourceText: Can you think of something else that is round like a tomato? ⚽
text: Kan jy aan nog iets dink wat rond is soos 'n tamatie? ⚽

SourceText: These fun food games build memory, observation, and language - helping your child compare, recall, and explore the world through everyday things 🏆
text: Hierdie lekker kosspeletjies bou geheue, waarneming en taal - dit help jou kind om vergelykings te maak, te herroep en die wêreld te verken deur alledaagse dinge 🏆

SourceText: *Animals*
text: *Diere*

SourceText: Here are 3 fun animal-related games you can play!
text: Hier is 3 prettige diereverwante speletjies wat julle kan speel!

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with @fields.child_nickname doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸 Aktiewe diere Maak beurte met @fields.child_nickname om diere-aksies te doen: Hop soos 'n padda, strek soos 'n kat, hardloop soos 'n hond, seil soos 'n slang, flap soos 'n voël.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with your child doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸 Aktiewe diere  Maak beurte met jou kind om diere-aksies te doen: Hop soos 'n padda, strek soos 'n kat, hardloop soos 'n hond, seil soos 'n slang, flap soos 'n voël.

SourceText: 💡 Groups of animals
text: 💡 Groepe diere

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers?
text: Aan watter diere kan ons almal dink wat vere het?

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱
text: Aan watter diere kan ons almal dink wat plante eet? 🌱

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that lay eggs?
text: Aan watter diere kan ons almal dink wat eiers lê?

SourceText: 😃 Counting rabbits
text: 😃 Tel hasies!

SourceText: 🔟 Find 10 rocks and tell your child that they are rabbits!
text: 🔟 Vind 10 klippe en sê vir jou kind dat hulle hasies is!

SourceText: Put them in a line and ask them to count the rabbits.
text: Sit hulle in 'n ry en vra hom/haar om die hasies te tel.

SourceText: Ask your child to give you 3 rabbits. Say “If you give me 3, how many rabbits do you have?”
text: Vra jou kind om vir jou 3 hasies te gee. Sê: "As jy vir my 3 gee, hoeveel hasies gaan jy dan hê?"

SourceText: These playful animal games build movement, counting, and thinking skills - while sparking your child’s curiosity about the natural world 🌈
text: Hierdie prettige dierespeletjies bevorder beweging, tel en denkvaardighede - terwyl jy jou kind se nuuskierigheid oor die natuur aanwakker 🌈

SourceText: *Active Counting*
text: *Tel Aktief*

SourceText: Here are 2 fun games that help your child learn how to count, listen, and remember!
text: Hier is 2 prettige speletjies wat jou kind leer om te tel, luister en onthou!

SourceText: 👋 Clap, hop, jump:
text: 👋 Klap, hop, spring:

SourceText: Play the following game with @fields.child_nickname. Make it active!
text: Speel die volgende speletjie met @fields.child_nickname. Maak dit aktief!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time. 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
text: 1️⃣ Klap hande 1 keer. 2️⃣ Klap hande 2 keer.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Jump 1 time. 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
text: 1️⃣ Spring 1 keer. 2️⃣ Spring 2 keer.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Hop 1 time. 3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
text: 1️⃣ Hop 1 keer. 3️⃣ Hop 3 keer.

SourceText: 💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap?
text: 💡 Kan jy hop, dan spring, dan klap?

SourceText: 🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
text: 🏆 Kan jy twee keer klap, een keer spring en drie keer huppel?

SourceText: Play the following game with your child. Make it active!
text: Speel die volgende speletjie met jou kind. Maak dit aktief!

SourceText: 💡 Remembering Instructions
text: 💡 Om Instruksies te Onthou

SourceText: Take turns to give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
text: Maak beurte om 2-3 instruksies te gee wat die ander persoon moet volg. Maak seker dat fisiese beweging ingesluit is!

SourceText: For example:
text: Byvoorbeeld:

SourceText: - Hop twice, then turn around.
text: - Hop twee keer, draai dan om.

SourceText: - Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. ✅
text: - Spring na die kombuis, tel 'n lepel op en hardloop dan terug. ✅

SourceText: These active games builds memory, coordination, and listening skills - helping your child follow instructions while moving their body 👋
text: Hierdie aktiewe speletjie bou geheue, koördinasie en luistervaardighede - dit help jou kind om instruksies te volg terwyl hy/sy sy/haar liggaampie beweeg 👋

SourceText: *Thinking Games*
text: *Dinkspeletjies*

SourceText: Let’s play some games to help your child think and follow instructions!
text: Speel speletjies wat jou kind help om te dink en instruksies te volg!

SourceText: ❗ Mama/Daddy says!
text: ❗ Mamma/Pappa se!

SourceText: Give your child brief instructions to follow, by saying: “Mama/daddy says… touch your head”.
text: Gee kort instruksies aan jou kind om te volg, deur te sê: "Mamma/Pappa sê ... vat aan jou kop".

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump twice”.
text: "Mamma/Pappa sê ... spring twee keer"

SourceText: Once your child understands the game well, you can make it more complicated!
text: Sodra jou kind die spel goed verstaan, kan jy dit meer ingewikkeld maak!

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump, then clap and sit”.
text: “Mamma/pappa sê… spring, klap dan en sit”.

SourceText: 🔵 🔴 Blue-Red
text: 🔵 🔴 Blou-Rooi

SourceText: Say a colour, and your child needs to quickly find and touch something of that colour.
text: Sê 'n kleur, dan moet jou kind vinnig aan iets raak wat dieselfde kleur is.

SourceText: To make the game harder, you can choose two colours and tell your child they should touch the opposite colour!
text: Om die speletjie moeiliker te maak, kan jy twee kleure kies en vir jou kind sê om aan die teenoorgestelde kleur te raak!

SourceText: “If I say blue, you should touch something red. If I say red, you need to touch something blue.”
text: "As ek blou sê, moet jy aan iets rooi vat. As ek rooi sê, moet jy aan iets blou vat".

SourceText: Try these games to help your child build listening skills, follow instructions, and have fun - all at the same time!
text: Probeer hierdie speletjies om jou kind te help met luistervaardighede, om instruksies uit te voer en pret te hê - alles op dieselfde tyd!

SourceText: 👂 Go and stop
text: 👂 Gaan en stop

SourceText: Say: When I say “stop”, we freeze. When I say “go”, we can walk again.
text: Sê: Wanneer ek sê “stop”, vries ons. Wanneer ek sê “gaan”, kan ons weer loop.

SourceText: Once @fields.child_nickname is familiar with the game, @fields.child_nickname will lead.
text: Wanneer @fields.child_nickname die speletjie ken, sal @fields.child_nickname die leiding neem.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Once your child is familiar with the game, your child will lead.
text: Wanneer jou kind die speletjie ken, sal jou kind die leiding neem.

SourceText: *Games with Pictures!*
text: *Speletjies met Prente!*

SourceText: Any picture or image can turn into a game:
text: Enige prentjie of beeld kan in 'n speletjie verander:

SourceText: 👂 Making up a story
text: 👂 Maak 'n storie op

SourceText: Find a picture with people or animals in an old newspaper, book, or magazine, or on packaging.
text: Kry 'n prentjie met mense of diere in 'n ou koerant, boek, tydskrif, of op verpakking.

SourceText: Say: “Let’s make up a story about this picture. I can start. This little girl is feeling very excited today. Why do you think she is feeling excited?”
text: Sê: "Kom ons maak ons eie storie met die prentjie. Ek kan begin. Hierdie dogtertjie voel vandag baie opgewonde. Hoekom dink jy is sy so opgewonde?"

SourceText: 😃 “She is holding her bag and has a big smile. Where do you think she is going?”
text: 😃 "Sy hou haar sak vas met 'n groot glimlag. Waar dink jy gaan sy heen?"

SourceText: 👀 Can you guess it?
text: 👀 Kan jy raai?

SourceText: Say: “I am going to describe something on the page and you need to guess what it is and point to it”. For example, “I see something that is green and moves slowly.
text: Sê: "Ek gaan iets op die prentjie beskryf en jy moet raai wat dit is en daarna wys." Byvoorbeeld: "Ek sien iets wat groen is en dit beweeg stadig."

SourceText: Can you guess what it is?” 💚
text: Kan jy raai wat dit is?” 💚

SourceText: These playful games build imagination, language, and thinking skills - while helping your child listen and express their own ideas in a fun way 💡
text: Hierdie prettige speletjies bou verbeelding, taal en denkvaardighede - terwyl dit jou kind help om te luister en sy/haar eie idees op 'n prettige manier uit te druk 💡

SourceText: *Tell Me a Story!*
text: *Vertel vir My 'n Storie!*

SourceText: 👂 Sit together in a cosy spot and begin a story the traditional way in your home language, like “Once upon a time...”
text: 👂 Sit saam op 'n snoesige plek en begin deur jou storie op die tradisionele manier in jou moedertaal te vertel, soos "Eendag, lank, lank gelede ..."

SourceText: ✨ Use your voice, hands, and expressions to bring the story to life. It could be about animals, a clever child, or a talking tree! Let your child add sounds or repeat words. You can even ask them what happens next!
text: ✨ Gebruik jou stem, hande en uitdrukkings om die storie lewe te gee. Dit moet gaan oor diere, 'n slim kind of 'n boom wat kan praat! Laat jou kind klanke byvoeg en woorde herhaal. Jy kan hulle selfs vra wat volgende gebeur!

SourceText: 💡 Traditional storytelling builds language, imagination, and cultural identity - and creates beautiful quiet time together.
text: 💡 Tradisionele stories bou taal, verbeelding en kulturele identiteit - en skep wonderlike stiltetyd saam.

SourceText: *Proverb Play*
text: *Spreekwoordespel*

SourceText: Let’s bring wisdom to life through play! ✨
text: Kweek lewenswysheid deur speel! ✨

SourceText: 🌱 Think of a traditional proverb and act it out together. Pretend to be the animal or act out the scenario of the proverb - use movement, voices, and imagination!
text: 🌱 Dink aan 'n tradisionele spreekwoord en voer dit saam uit. Maak of jy die dier is of voer die spreekwoord uit - gebruik beweging. stemme en verbeelding!

SourceText: 📖 Here are some ideas to get you started:
text: 📖 Hier is 'n paar idees om jou aan die gang te kry:

SourceText: - “Even an ant can hurt an elephant” - Pretend to be a big stomping elephant, then tiny ants that tickle its feet!
text: - "Selfs 'n mier kan 'n olifant seermaak" - Maak of jy 'n grootpoot-olifant is, dan miertjies wat die olifant se pote kielie!

SourceText: - “The lion doesn’t turn around when a small dog barks” - Be the calm, wise lion ignoring a noisy pup.
text: - "Die leeu draai nie om wanneer 'n klein hondjie blaf nie" - Maak of jy 'n kalm, wyse leeu is wat 'n rasende hondjie ignoreer.

SourceText: - “Wisdom is like a baobab tree - no one can embrace it alone” - Stand in a circle and stretch your arms to build a tree together.
text: - "Wysheid is soos 'n kremetartboom - niemand kan dit alleen omhels nie" - Staan in 'n sirkel en strek jou arms om 'n boom te vorm.

SourceText: - “A single bracelet does not jingle” - Clap or tap together and see how much louder it is with more hands!
text: - "Een armband maak nie 'n geluid nie" - Klap of tik en kyk hoeveel harder dit kan wees met meer hande!

SourceText: 👀Ask your child what they think the proverb means.
text: 👀 Vra wat hulle dink die spreekwoord beteken.

SourceText: This playful activity helps children explore big ideas like courage, kindness, and teamwork - through their bodies and imagination 💡
text: Hierdie prettige aktiwiteit help kinders om groot idees te verken, soos moed, vriendelikheid en spanwerk - deur hulle liggaampies en verbeelding 💡

SourceText: *I'm a Writer!*
text: *Ek's 'n Skrywer!*

SourceText: 📝 Have fun being creative with writing!
text: 📝 Geniet dit om kreatief te wees met skryfwerk!

SourceText: You and @fields.child_nickname can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Jy en @fields.child_nickname kan skryfpret hê met 'n potlood op papier, of met 'n stokkie in die sand!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If your child doesn’t know how to write letters, encourage them to draw shapes, and try to copy the shapes of letters. 🔵▶️
text: As kinders nie weet hoe om letters te skryf nie, moedig hulle aan om vorms te teken en te probeer om die vorms van letters na te boots.🔵▶️

SourceText: When they are more confident, encourage them to write letters and even words. 😃
text: Wanneer hulle meer selfvertroue het, moedig hulle aan om meer letters en woorde te skryf. 😃

SourceText: Start showing them how to write their name and other important words for them, like mom, ball or milk.
text: Begin deur vir hulle te wys hoe om hulle naam en ander belangrike woorde te skryf, soos ma, bal of melk.

SourceText: Show them the simple things that you write - like shopping lists! Show them the words and each of the letters. Let them try to copy the words! 📖
text: Wys vir hulle die eenvoudige goed wat jy skryf - soos inkopielysies! Wys vir hulle die woorde en elke letter. Laat hulle probeer om die woorde te kopieer! 📖

SourceText: You and your child can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Jy en jou kind kan skryfpret hê met 'n potlood op papier, of met 'n stokkie in die sand!

SourceText: 🎉This playful writing time builds confidence, creativity, and early literacy - helping your child see that writing is useful and fun.
text: 🎉 Hierdie prettige skryftyd bou selfvertroue, kreatiwiteit en vroeë geletterdheid - dit help jou kind om te sien dat skryf nuttig en lekker is.

SourceText: *A Friendly Chat*
text: *'n Vriendelike geselsie*

SourceText: Talk to your child about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Praat met jou kind oor wat vir hom/haar interessant is! 😃

SourceText: 💚 Spending quality time with your child and talking to them every day is a good way to develop a strong relationship.
text: 💚 Om kwaliteittyd met jou kind te spandeer en daagliks met hom/haar te gesels, is 'n goeie manier om 'n sterk verhouding te ontwikkel.

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your child is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ 'n Maklike manier om met jou kind te begin gesels, is om uit te vra oor iets wat hom/haar interesseer. Jy kan byvoorbeeld oor onderwerpe praat soos sport, boeke, flieks, vriende, musiek, bekendes of skool.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your child shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Nie alles wat jou kind met jou deel, gaan vir jou interessant wees nie, maar dis belangrik om entoesiasme te wys, asook gretigheid om meer uit te vind.
