SourceText: Talking about their interests builds trust, confidence, and communication skills - and shows your child that what they care about matters to you 💛
text: Om oor hul belangstelling te praat, bou vertroue en kommunikasievaardighede - dit wys jou kind dat hulle belangstelling is vir jou belangrik💛

SourceText: *Get Active*
text: *Raak aktief*

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health.
text: Oefening is 'n goeie manier om tyd saam te spandeer en dis goed vir jou gesondheid.

SourceText: 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your child want to do and try it out together!
text: 🌱 Vind 'n sport of oefening wat beide jy en jou kind sal geniet en probeer dit saam!

SourceText: ⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.
text: ⏰ Selfs 10 minute se stap per dag is goed vir jou.

SourceText: ⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport.
text: ⚽ Julle kan saam hardloop, sokker speel, swem, dans of enige ander sport doen.

SourceText: 🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?
text: 🏆 Dink saam aan maniere om dit selfs nog meer pret te maak. Kan julle tot by 'n sekere plek draf? Beurte neem om die afrigter te wees? Kan daar 'n klein, gratis beloning wees, soos om die volgende aktiwiteit te mag kies?

SourceText: 🌈 Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.
text: 🌈 Oefening raak makliker en meer genotvol, hoe meer jy dit doen.

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your child do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: 🔄 As jy en jou kind nie van die eerste oefening wat julle gekies het, hou nie, probeer 'n nuwe een.

SourceText: *Pass the Ball*
text: *Gee die Bal aan*

SourceText: Games are a great, fun way to spend time with your family!
text: Speletjies is 'n wonderlike, prettige manier om tyd saam met jou gesin deur te bring!

SourceText: 3️⃣ This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: 3️⃣Hierdie speletjie werk die beste met ten minste 3 mense.

SourceText: ⚽ Find a ball to play. If you cannot find a ball, choose an item you can safely throw around. For example, a bottle cap or a plastic cup.
text: ⚽ Kry 'n bal om mee te speel. As julle nie 'n bal kan kry nie, kies 'n item wat julle veilig kan rondgooi, byvoorbeeld 'n bottelprop of 'n plastiekglasie.

SourceText: ➡️ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: ➡️ Begin in 'n sirkel en gooi die bal in die rondte.

SourceText: 👋 Start throwing the ball in new directions (up, down, straight, curved, rolling on the ground) and with different forces (hard, soft, medium). You can bounce the ball, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: 👋 Begin die bal in nuwe rigtings gooi (op, af, reguit, met 'n kurwe, rol dit op die grond) en met wisselende krag (hard, sag, medium). Jy kan die bal bons, dit in die lug gooi en dit 'n paar keer in die lug gooi en vang voordat jy dit aanstuur.

SourceText: ✨ When everyone gets good at catching the ball, you can start moving around the room, still passing the ball.
text: ✨ Wanneer almal begin goed raak daarmee om die bal te vang, kan julle begin om in die vertrek rond te beweeg en steeds vir mekaar die bal aan te gee.

SourceText: ⭐ Can you throw the ball under the leg? Behind the back? Over your head? Block a pass? Have fun with it!
text: ⭐ Kan jy die bal tussen jou bene deur gooi? Agter jou rug? Oor jou kop? 'n Aangee blokkeer? Geniet dit!

SourceText: This lively game helps you connect to your child in a fun way - while building their coordination, teamwork, and focus 🚩
text: Hierdie opwindende speletjie help om met jou kind te verbind op 'n prettige manier - terwyl sy/haar koördinasie, spanwerk en fokus gebou word 🚩

SourceText: *Follow the Leader!*
text: *Volg die Leier!*

SourceText: ⭐ Choose someone to be the leader (tip: start with an adult like yourself).
text: ⭐ Kies iemand om die leier te wees (wenk: begin met 'n volwassene soos jyself).

SourceText: 😃 Other players line up behind the leader. The leader moves around in any way they like!
text: 😃 Ander spelers maak 'n ry agter die leier. Die leier beweeg rond op enige manier wat hulle wil!

SourceText: 🏁 They can run, jump, crawl, walk on tiptoe, and any other way they want!
text: 🏁 Hulle kan hardloop, spring, kruip, op hulle tone loop, en enige ander manier wat hulle wil!

SourceText: 👀 The other players must copy what the leader does, and the leader can change movements at any time.
text: 👀 Die ander spelers moet die leier se bewegings naboots, en die leier kan te eniger tyd die bewegings verander.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns being the leader, and remember, you can play with just two people or as many as you want!
text: 🔄 Maak beurte om die leier te wees en onthou dat jy met net twee mense kan speel, of meer as jy wil!

SourceText: This game builds movement skills, attention and listening, and self-control, while having fun together! 👂
text: Hierdie speletjie bou bewegingsvaardighede, aandag, luister en selfbeheersing, terwyl julle pret saam het! 👂

SourceText: *Emotion Cards*
text: *Emosiekaarte*

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with @fields.child_nickname: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: Ontwerp saam met @fields.child_nickname kaarte met die ses belangrikste emosies: gelukkig, hartseer, kwaad, gewalg, verras, bang 😃😔😣
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔶 Draw, cut-out pictures from magazines, or take photos of family members showing different emotions.
text: 🔶 Teken, knip prente uit 'n tydskrif, of neem foto's van gesinslede wat verskillende emosies toon.

SourceText: 📝 Label each emotion and describe how each family member feels those emotions.
text: 📝 Etiketteer elke emosie en beskryf hoe elke familielid daardie emosie voel.

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with your child: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: Ontwerp saam met jou kind kaarte met die ses belangrikste emosies daarop: gelukkig, hartseer, kwaad, gewalg, verras, bang 😃😔😣

SourceText: 🚩 Put the cards in a spot everyone agrees on, and use it throughout the day to name how everyone is feeling. For example, after school, everyone can point out the emotion they are experiencing.
text: 🚩 Plaas die kaarte op 'n plek waaroor almal saamstem en gebruik dit deur die dag om te sê hoe elkeen voel. Na skool kan almal byvoorbeeld die emosies uitwys wat hulle ervaar.

SourceText: 💡 Feel free to add new feelings as they come up. If someone doesn’t know what they are feeling, help them identify it by exploring how it feels in their body. Try together to find a new word for that emotion.
text: 💡 Voeg gerus meer emosies by soos dit voorkom. As iemand nie weet wat hulle voel nie, help hulle om dit te identifiseer deur dit in hul liggaam te verken. Probeer om saam 'n nuwe woord vir die emosie te vind.

SourceText: This can help everyone in the family become experts in understanding themselves and be aware of what their bodies need! 💛
text: Dit kan almal in die gesin help om kenners te word en hulself te verstaan en om bewus te raak van wat hul liggaam nodig het! 💛

SourceText: *What's New?*
text: *Wat’s Nuut?*

SourceText: Learning together is fun! 🎓
text: Om saam te leer, is pret! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your child to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓ Vra jou kind om te dink aan 'n nuwe, prettige vaardigheid wat julle saam kan leer.

SourceText: For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa.
text: Byvoorbeeld: om 'n bal met jou voet in die lug te hou, "juggle", sop maak, "moonwalk", fluit, die alfabet agterstevoor op te sê, al die lande in Afrika te leer.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Neem beurte om die nuwe vaardigheid te probeer. Maak seker dat julle mekaar prys, leer en saam speel!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your child or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Benader die leer van 'n vaardigheid op 'n vriendelike, prettige manier en moenie jou kind of jouself oordeel oor jul vermoë in die vaardigheid nie.

SourceText: 😃 Once you have mastered the skill, choose another skill to learn together.
text: 😃 As julle die vaardigheid bemeester het, kies 'n ander vaardigheid om saam aan te leer.

SourceText: *Five Stones*
text: *Vyf Klippies*

SourceText: Let’s test your speed and skill with this classic hand game played across South Africa! ⭐
text: Kom ons toets jou spoed en vaardighede met hierdie klassieke handspeletjie, wat regoor Suid-Afrika gespeel word! ⭐

SourceText: 5️⃣ You’ll need five small stones (or any small objects you have around).
text: 5️⃣ Jy het vyf klein klippies nodig (of klein voorwerpe wat jy beskikbaar het).

SourceText: ▶️ Start by placing all five on the ground. Pick up one and throw it gently into the air. While it’s in the air, quickly grab one stone from the ground and catch the first stone before it lands.
text: ▶️ Begin deur al vyf op die grond te sit. Tel een op en gooi dit versigtig in die lug. Terwyl dit in die lug is, gryp vinnig een klippie van die grond af en vang die eerste klippie voor dit val.

SourceText: 🔄 Repeat this, picking up one stone at a time. Then try two at once, then three... all the way to four!
text: 🔄 Herhaal dit, soos jy elke keer een klippie op 'n slag optel. Probeer dan twee op 'n slag ... tot by vier!

SourceText: 🚩 Play alone or with friends, and see who can complete the challenge without dropping a stone!
text: 🚩 Speel alleen of saam met vriende en kyk wie kan die uitdaging voltooi sonder om die klip te laat val!

SourceText: This traditional game builds hand-eye coordination, focus, and timing - and it’s lots of fun to master ✅
text: Hierdie tradisionele speletjie bou hand-oog-koördinasie, fokus en tydsberekening - en dis tonne pret om dit te bemeester ✅

SourceText: *Clap & Sing Game*
text: *Klap-en-Singspeletjie*

SourceText: 🎵 Sit face-to-face with your child and try a fun clapping rhyme together.
text: 🎵 Sit aangesig-tot-aangesig met jou kind en probeer 'n prettige handeklapritme saam.

SourceText: 👋 Clap your hands, then each other’s, and repeat with a rhythm and song from your childhood – or make up a new one.
text: 👋 Klap julle hande, dan mekaar s'n, en herhaal met 'n ritme en liedjie van jou kinderjare - of maak 'n nuwe een op.

SourceText: 💚 Follow the words with a simple clapping pattern. You can swap in your own words or names to make it even more fun!
text: 💚 Volg die woorde met 'n eenvoudige handeklappatroon. Jy kan jou eie woorde of name gebruik om dit meer pret te maak!

SourceText: These clapping games have been popular among children from generation to generation, and help build rhythm, timing, memory, and laughter ✨
text: Hierdie handeklapspeletjies is reeds geslagte lank baie gewild onder kinders, en dit help om ritme, tydsberekening, geheue en lag te ontwikkel ✨

SourceText: *Skipping Rope Song*
text: * Springtouliedjie*

SourceText: 🎈 Find a long rope or make one from tied-up tights or string.
text: 🎈 Soek 'n lang tou of maak een van sykouse of stringe wat aan mekaar gebind is.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Two people turn the rope while one jumps in the middle.
text: 2️⃣ Twee mense swaai die tou, terwyl een in die middel spring.

SourceText: 🎵 Sing a song together as they jump – do you remember one from your childhood or can you use a different song you all know?
text: 🎵 Sing 'n liedjie saam terwyl hulle spring - onthou jy een uit jou kinderjare of kan julle 'n ander liedjie sing wat almal ken?

SourceText: 🏆 You can add fun moves like hopping, clapping, or even dancing while skipping.
text: 🏆 Julle kan prettige bewegings byvoeg, soos hop, hande klap, of selfs dans terwyl julle spring.

SourceText: 💛 Then switch places so everyone gets a turn.
text: 💛 Ruil dan plekke om sodat elkeen 'n beurt kry.

SourceText: This energetic game builds coordination, confidence, and teamwork - and brings a joyful beat to any outdoor play session 🌈
text: Hierdie energieke speletjies bou koördinasie, selfvertroue en spanwerk - en skep 'n vreugdevolle atmosfeer vir 'n buitespeelsessie 🌈

SourceText: *Three Tin Tower*
text: *Driebliktoring*

SourceText: 🔶 Stack three empty tins into a tower.
text: 🔶 Pak drie leë blikkies op mekaar soos 'n toring.

SourceText: 🔵 One player throws a soft ball to knock them down while others run away.
text: 🔵 Een speler gooi 'n sagte bal om die blikkies om te gooi, terwyl die ander weghardloop.

SourceText: ⏰ The “tin guard” collects and rebuilds the tower as quickly as possible while trying to tag the runners.
text: ⏰ Die "blikbeskermer" versamel die blikke en herbou die bliktoring so vinnig as moontlik, terwyl hy poog om die hardlopers aan te raak.

SourceText: 🔄 If you get tagged, you switch roles!
text: 🔄 Wanneer jy geraak word, ruil julle rolle om!

SourceText: This game is lots of fun and builds teamwork, movement skills, and fast thinking 🎉
text: Hierdie speletjie is propvol pret en bou spanwerk, bewegingsvaardighede en vinnige denke 🎉

SourceText: *Story Stones*
text: *Storieklippies*

SourceText: 🔴 Sit quietly with a handful of small stones.
text: 🔴 Sit doodstil met 'n handvol klein klippies.

SourceText: 📖 Let your child imagine what the stones are, move them around and tell a story in their own words. It might be about animals, people, dreams, or anything they imagine.
text: 📖 Laat jou kind toe om hom/haar te verbeel dat die klippies iets anders is, laat hom/haar dit rondbeweeg en 'n storie in sy/haar eie woorde vertel. Dit kan gaan oor diere, mense, drome of enigiets waaraan hy/sy kan dink.

SourceText: 👂You can listen quietly or help shape the story together.
text: 👂 Jy kan stil sit en luister of help om die storie vorm te gee.

SourceText: This solo storytelling tradition helps children express feelings, practise language, and explore imagination - all through play and pretend 💛
text: Hierdie solo-storieverteltradisie help kinders om hul gevoelens te deel, taal te oefen en verbeelding te verken - alles deur speel en voorgee 💛

SourceText: It’s a beautiful, calming game rooted in traditional storytelling 🌙
text: Dis 'n wonderlike kalmerende speletjie, gewortel in tradisionele storievertelling 🌙

SourceText: *Hopscotch Fun*
text: *Eenbeentjie-pret*

SourceText: Let’s jump into a classic game! ☀️
text: Kom ons skop af met 'n klassieke speletjie! ☀️

SourceText: 🔷 Draw a hopscotch grid on the ground using chalk, a stick in the sand, or even tape on the floor indoors. Number the squares from 1 to 9.
text: 🔷 Teken 'n eenbeentjiediagram op die grond met kryt, stok in die grond, of selfs kleeflint op die vloer binne in die huis. Nommer die vierkantblokke van 1 tot 9.

SourceText: 🔴 Give your child a small object (like a stone or bottle top) to toss into square 1.
text: 🔴 Gee jou kind 'n klein voorwerpie (soos 'n klippie of 'n botteldoppie) om in vierkant 1 te gooi.

SourceText: ⬆️ Then they hop through the squares on one foot—skipping the square with the marker—then turn around and come back.
text: ⬆️ Dan spring hy/sy op een been deur die vierkante - hy/sy mis die vierkant met die merker - en draai dan om en kom terug.

SourceText: ⬇️ Stop to pick up the marker on the way back, still hopping!
text: ⬇️ Wanneer hy/sy terugkom, stop hy/sy om die merker op te tel, al springende!

SourceText: 🔄 Next round: throw the marker into square 2... and so on.
text: 🔄 Volgende rondte: gooi die merker in vierkant 2 ... en gaan so voort.

SourceText: Hopscotch builds balance, counting, turn-taking, and fun movement skills. You can sing as you hop or make your own rules for extra challenge! 🎈
text: Eenbeentjie bou balans, tel, beurte maak en prettige bewegingsvaardighede. Jy kan sing terwyl jy spring, of maak jou eie reëls vir 'n ekstra uitdaging! 🎈

SourceText: *Pattern Discovery*
text: *Patroon-ontdekking*

SourceText: Did you know that patterns are all around us? 🎨
text: Het jy geweet dat patrone oral om ons is? 🎨

SourceText: 🌷 Explore patterns together - whether it's the rows of palm trees outside or the design on their clothes.
text: 🌷 Verken patrone saam - of dit die ry palmbome buite is of die ontwerp op hul klere.

SourceText: 🔷 Line up colourful blocks, rocks, or feathers, or draw a pattern using simple shapes. Ask your child questions like: “What comes next?’” or “Can you create your own pattern?”
text: 🔷 Sit kleurvolle blokke, klippe of vere neer, of teken 'n patroon deur eenvoudige vorms te gebruik. Vra jou kind vrae soos: "Wat kom volgende?" of "Kan jy jou eie patroon maak?"

SourceText: 🎉Remember to encourage and celebrate their curiosity as they explore the world of patterns!
text: 🎉 Onthou om hom/haar aan te moedig en sy/haar nuuskierigheid te vier terwyl hy/sy die wêreld van patrone rondom hom/haar verken!

SourceText: Your child will start by noticing patterns, and before you know it, they will be copying and creating their own patterns! 📝
text: Jou kind sal patrone begin oplet en voor jy weet, boots hy/sy patrone na of maak sy/haar eie! 📝

SourceText: Recognizing patterns helps prepare your child for future maths skills 💡
text: Patroonherkenning berei jou kind voor vir toekomstige wiskundige vaardighede 💡

SourceText: *Guess the Emotion*
text: *Raai die Emosie*

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child, “What does it look like when we’re happy? Angry? Surprised?”
text: 👀 Vra jou kind: "Hoe lyk dit wanneer ons gelukkig is? Kwaad? Verras?"

SourceText: 👂 Take turns acting out different emotions and guessing what the other person is feeling. Using a silly voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 👂 Maak beurte om verskillende emosies te wys en raai wat die ander persoon voel. Deur 'n snaakse stem te gebruik, kan jy verskillende redes gee waarom jy daardie emosie voel.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Dit is nie net 'n speletjie nie - dis 'n geleentheid vir jou kind om te leer om emosies in ander te herken 💚

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and
text: So, maak gereed om 'n paar emosies uit te beeld en

SourceText: enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: geniet hierdie spesiale speelaktiwiteit saam! 🌈

SourceText: *Picture Puzzle*
text: *Prentelegkaart*

SourceText: Get ready to turn a picture into a fun jigsaw puzzle that boosts memory and direction skills! 🎨
text: Maak gereed om 'n prent in 'n prettige legkaart te omskep om daardie geheue en aanwysingsvaardighede 'n hupstoot te gee 🎨

SourceText: 📝 You’ll need scissors and a picture from a paper or magazine - or a picture that you have drawn yourself.
text: 📝Jy het 'n skêr en 'n prent uit 'n tydskrif of koerant nodig - of 'n prent wat julle self geteken het.

SourceText: 💡 First, cut the picture into at least three pieces. Older children can try cutting up the pieces for younger children if they already know how to use scissors safely.
text: 💡 Eerstens, knip die prent in ten minste drie stukke. Ouer kinders kan probeer om die dele op te knip vir jonger kinders, as hulle reeds weet hoe om 'n skêr te gebruik.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, flip the pieces face down so you can’t see the picture.
text: 🔷 Draai nou die stukke met die gesigkant na onder, sodat jy nie die prent kan sien nie.

SourceText: ✅ Your challenge? Rebuild the picture together by turning over one piece at a time and putting it back together.
text: ✅ Julle uitdaging? Herbou die prentjie saam deur een vir een die stukke om te draai en die prent weer aanmekaar te sit.

SourceText: 👀 If your child needs a little help, ask guiding questions like, 'Where do you think this piece goes?'
text: 👀 As jou kind hulp nodig het, vra leidende vrae soos, "Waar dink jy kom hierdie stuk?"

SourceText: It’s a quick and fun way to strengthen memory and problem-solving skills! ✨
text: Dis 'n vinnige en lekker manier om die kind se geheue en probleemoplossingsvaardighede te versterk! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle

SourceText: *Superhero Costume Raffle*
text: *Superheldkostuum-Lootjie*

SourceText: You can transform into superheroes with this fun and imaginative dressing-up game! 👑
text: Jy kan in 'n superheld verander in hierdie prettige en verbeeldingryke aantrekspeletjie! 👑

SourceText: 2️⃣ Here’s what you’ll need: Two items of clothing for each person playing, and a pillowcase or bag to hold them.
text: 2️⃣Hier is wat jy nodig het: Twee kledingstukke vir elke persoon wat speel, en 'n kussingsloop of sak om alles in te sit.

SourceText: 🎁 Start by placing all the clothes in the pillowcase.
text: 🎁 Begin deur al die klere in die kussingsloop te sit.

SourceText: 👀 Hand the pillowcase to the smallest player first. Make sure their eyes are shut, then let them pull out one item of clothing.
text: 👀 Gee die kussingsloop eerste vir die kleinste speler. Maak seker dat sy/haar oë toe is, en laat hy/sy dan een kledingstuk uithaal.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, pass the case around until everyone gets two items of clothing.
text: 🔄 Stuur dan die sloop in die rondte tot elkeen twee kledingstukke het.

SourceText: ✨ Now, everyone takes turns to imagine what superpower their pieces of clothing give them. Maybe a scarf makes you fly, or a hat gives you super speed - it’s totally up to your imagination!
text: ✨ Nou kry almal 'n geleentheid om hulle te verbeel watter superheld hulle gaan wees. Miskien laat die serp jou vlieg, of 'n hoed gee jou vinniger spoed - dit hang heeltemal van jou verbeelding af!

SourceText: 🚗 Now it’s time to play! Put on your superpower clothes and act out a story together, like saving the world from a monster.
text: 🚗 Nou is dit tyd om te speel! Trek jou superkragklere aan en speel saam 'n rollespel-storie, soos om die wêreld van 'n monster te red.

SourceText: It’s a fantastic way to encourage creative thinking, flexible language skills, and playful bonding 💛
text: Dis 'n fantastiese manier om kreatiewe denke, buigsame taalgebruik en prettige verbintenisse aan te moedig 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery

SourceText: *Letter Hunt*
text: *Letterjag*

SourceText: Turn your home into a scavenger hunt with this fun and interactive letter game ✅
text: Omskep jou huis in 'n skattejagterrein met hierdie prettige interaktiewe letterspeletjie ✅

SourceText: 📝 Here is what you need: paper and a pen.
text: 📝 Hier is wat jy nodig het: papier en 'n pen.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Start by writing down each letter of the alphabet - one letter per piece of paper. Once you are done, place the papers face down so you can’t see the letters.
text: 1️⃣ Begin deur elke letter van die alfabet neer te skryf - een letter per vel papier. Wanneer jy klaar is, plaas die papiere op hul gesigkant neer sodat jy nie die letters kan sien nie.

SourceText: 👀 Now, turn over one piece of paper to reveal a letter. The challenge? Find objects around your house that begin with that letter! Once you've found an item, place it next to the letter on the paper.
text: 👀 Draai nou een papier om en wys die letter. Die uitdaging? Vind voorwerpe in en om jou huis wat met daardie letter begin! Sodra jy 'n item gevind het, sit dit langs die letter op die papier.

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the hunt going! Flip over the next letter and search for another object. Continue until you’ve gone through all the letters.
text: 🔄 Hou die skattejag aan die gang! Draai die volgende letter om en soek 'n ander voorwerp. Gaan voort tot jy deur al die letters gegaan het.

SourceText: This activity is perfect for blending learning with active play, while giving your little ones a fun way to practise their alphabet and creativity! 💡
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit is perfek om leer met aktiewe spel te meng, terwyl jy jou kleinding 'n prettige manier wys om die alfabet en hul kreatiwiteit te oefen! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see

SourceText: *Hot or cold*
text: *Warm of Koud*

SourceText: Ready to hunt for hidden treasure using clues? 🎁
text: Gereed om vir versteekte skatte te jag deur leidrade te gebruik? 🎁

SourceText: ⚽ Here’s what you’ll need: something easy to hide, like toys or balls.
text: ⚽ Hier is wat jy nodig het: iets wat jy maklik kan wegsteek, soos speelgoed of balle.

SourceText: 👀 One player hides an object, while the others close their eyes. The player who hid the object will now give clues to help the others find it.
text: 👀 Een speler versteek 'n voorwerp, terwyl die ander hul oë toemaak. Die speler wat die voorwerp weggesteek het, sal leidrade gee om die ander te help om die voorwerp te kry.

SourceText: ☀️ When the person searching is getting close to where the object is hidden, the hider can say “getting warm!” or “hot!”, and when the searcher is going in the wrong direction, the hider can say “getting colder…”.
text: ☀️ Wanneer die een wat soek, naby die versteekte voorwerp is, kan die versteker sê "jy word warmer" of "warm" en as die soeker in die verkeerde rigting gaan, kan die versteker sê "jy word koud".

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding objects and giving clues - it’s fun for everyone to get involved!
text: 🔄 Maak beurte om die voorwerp weg te steek en leidrade te gee - dis pret vir almal om betrokke te raak!

SourceText: 💡 For an extra challenge, hide multiple objects around the house and create a treasure map.
text: 💡 Vir 'n ekstra uitdaging, steek meer voorwerpe rondom jou huis weg en maak 'n skatkaart.

SourceText: This fun-filled game is perfect for challenging problem-solving and communication skills while keeping everyone engaged with exciting clues! ✨
text: Hierdie prettige speletjie is perfek vir uitdagende probleemoplossing en kommunikasievaardighede, terwyl almal betrokke gehou word met opwindende leidrade! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt

SourceText: *Shine a Light*
text: *Skyn 'n Lig*

SourceText: Let your creativity shine with shadow drawing! Here’s what you’ll need: pens, paper, and a light ▶️
text: Laat jou kreatiwiteit uitstraal met skadutekening! Hier is wat jy gaan nodig het: penne, papier en 'n lig ▶️

SourceText: 👀 Let your child choose an object that they would like to draw - it could be anything from around the house, like a cup or a favourite toy. 📝 Have them place the object upright on a blank sheet of paper.
text: 👀 Laat jou kind 'n voorwerp kies wat hy/sy graag wil teken - dit kan enigiets in en om die huis wees, soos 'n koppie of 'n gunstelingspeelding. 📝Laat jou kind die voorwerp regop op die leë vel papier neersit.

SourceText: 💡 Hold the light behind the object so the shadow appears on the paper. You can take turns holding the light, or rest it on something sturdy to keep your hands free for drawing.
text: 💡 Hou die lig agter die voorwerp sodat die skaduwee op die papier verskyn. Julle kan beurte maak om die lig vas te hou, of dit op iets stewigs laat rus om julle hande vry te hou om te teken.

SourceText: 🎨 Now, guide your child so they can trace the shadow’s outline on the paper.
text: 🎨 Help nou jou kind om die buitelyn van die skadu op die papier af te teken.

SourceText: ✨ Once they have finished drawing the shape, it’s time to get creative! Colour and decorate the shadow together to add your own artistic touch.
text: ✨ Wanneer hy/sy klaar die vorm geteken het, is dit tyd om kreatief te raak! Versier en kleur die skadu saam in om julle eie kunstige gevoel te gee.

SourceText: 📖 For extra fun, make up a story about the shadow object together as you decorate. What is it doing today?
text: 📖 Vir ekstra pret, maak saam 'n storie op oor die skaduvoorwerp terwyl julle dit versier. Wat sal dit vandag doen?

SourceText: This activity is a fun and imaginative way to boost creativity and flexible thinking while exploring shadows and light 🌈
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit is pret en verbeeldingryk, dit gee sy/haar kreatiwiteit en buigsame denke 'n hupstoot terwyl hy/sy die lig en skaduwees verken 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light

SourceText: *Colour Hunt*
text: *Kleurejag*

SourceText: Get ready for a colourful adventure that will challenge your child’s thinking and focus 🎨
text: Maak gereed vir 'n kleurvolle avontuur wat uitdagend vir jou kinders se denke en fokus sal wees🎨

SourceText: 5️⃣ Gather 5 small objects with different colours (like crayons, building blocks or anything else you have in the house).
text: 5️⃣ Maak 5 klein voorwerpe met verskillende kleure bymekaar (soos kryte, boublokkies of enigiets anders wat jy in die huis het).

SourceText: 🎁 Place all the coloured objects in a bag. Each participant picks one object from the bag to get started.
text: 🎁 Plaas al die gekleurde voorwerpe in 'n sak. Elke deelnemer kies een voorwerp uit die sak om te begin.

SourceText: 👀 Now, the challenge begins! Each player must find three other objects around the house that are the same colour as the object they picked. Search everywhere for the perfect matches!
text: 👀 Nou begin die uitdaging! Elke speler moet drie ander voorwerpe in en om die huis vind wat dieselfde kleur is as die voorwerp wat hy/sy gekies het. Soek oral vir die perfekte maat!

SourceText: 🚩 When a player finds an object that matches the colour, they place it next to the object and shout "match!"
text: 🚩 Wanneer 'n speler 'n voorwerp van dieselfde kleur vind, sit hy/sy dit langs die voorwerp neer en skree "pas!"

SourceText: 🔄 Once a player has found three matching objects, they can head back to the bag, choose another colour, and start the hunt all over again!
text: 🔄Wanneer 'n speler drie bypassende voorwerpe gevind het, kan hy/sy teruggaan na die sak om 'n ander kleur te kies en die skattejag weer van vooraf begin!

SourceText: Colour Hunt is a fantastic way to boost focus, encourage problem-solving, and keep everyone moving and engaged. Let the colourful treasure hunt begin! ✅
text: Kleurejag is 'n fantastiese manier om sy/haar fokus 'n hupstoot te gee, probleemoplossing aan te moedig en almal aan die beweeg en betrokke te hou. Laat die kleurvolle skattejag begin!✅

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt

SourceText: *Round & Round*
text: *Al In Die Rondte*

SourceText: 👋 Grab each other’s hands and form a circle.
text: 👋Vat mekaar se hande en maak 'n sirkel.

SourceText: 🎵 Walk round and round while you sing a song you know – it could be one from your childhood like “Ring-a-Rosy” or “Sawa Sonke”, or a favourite your child loves.
text: 🎵 Loop al in die rondte terwyl julle 'n liedjie sing wat julle ken - dit kan een uit jou kinderjare wees soos "Wielie-Wielie-Walie" of jou kind se gunsteling.

SourceText: 🎉 As you go round, add some silly moves to make it even more fun. Try hopping on one leg, see if you can put your leg over the next person’s arm, or gently fall to the ground when the song finishes.
text: 🎉 Terwyl julle in die rondte beweeg, voeg 'n paar lawwe bewegings by om dit selfs nog meer pret te maak. Probeer om op een been te spring, kyk of jy jou been oor die ander een se arm kan sit, of val saggies op die grond wanneer die liedjie klaar is.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns choosing the next move or song!
text: 🔄 Maak beurte om die volgende musiek of beweging te kies!

SourceText: This activity builds connection, encourages coordination and balance, and sparks lots of laughter and creativity 😃
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit bou verbintenis, moedig koördinasie en balans aan en laat vrolikheid en kreatiwiteit opvlam 😃

SourceText: *Freeze Like a Statue*
text: *Vries Soos 'n Standbeeld*

SourceText: 👀 Let your child shape you into a frozen statue - you might be a tree, a happy, sad or angry person, or anything else they imagine!
text: 👀 Laat jou kind jou soos 'n standbeeld toemaak - jy kan dalk 'n boom wees, 'n persoon wat gelukkig, hartseer of kwaad is, of enigiets waaraan hy/sy kan dink!

SourceText: 🚩 You can even invite others to join and let your child shape you all into a frozen scene, like a classroom, a soccer match, or something completely silly.
text: 🚩 Jy kan selfs ander saamnooi, dat jou kind almal in 'n gevriesde toneel vorm, soos 'n klaskamer, 'n sokkerwedstryd of iets heeltemal laf.

SourceText: 📱 Once the statue is ready, your child can be the ‘photographer’ and take a pretend (or real!) picture.
text: 📱 Wanneer die standbeeld gereed is, kan jou kind die "fotograaf" wees en maak of hy/sy 'n foto neem (of 'n regte foto neem).

SourceText: 🔄 Then swap roles and let them be the statue next.
text: 🔄 Ruil dan rolle om en laat hy/sy nou weer die standbeeld wees.

SourceText: This activity encourages creativity, role-play, and imagination - while building confidence through leading and observing ⭐
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit moedig kreatiwiteit, rolspel en verbeelding aan - terwyl selfvertroue gebou word deur leiding en waarneming⭐

SourceText: *Peg and Pretend*
text: *Pennetjies en Rolspel*

SourceText: Get creative with easy household items! 🧸
text: Raak kreatief met huishoudelike items!🧸

SourceText: 👋 Grab 10 clothing pegs – or more if you have – and build a shape by pegging them together. Let your child build their own creation too!
text: 👋 Kry 10 wasgoedpennetjies - of meer as jy wil - en bou 'n figuur deur die pennetjies aan mekaar vas te knyp. Laat jou kind ook sy/haar eie skepping maak!

SourceText: 🎨 Ask your child what their shape could be. A bug? A spaceship? A crocodile? Act out a little story using the peg creations.
text: 🎨 Vra jou kind wat sy/haar figuur kan wees. 'n Gogga? 'n Ruimteskip? 'n Krokodil? Rolspel 'n kort storie deur die pennetjieskeppings te gebruik.

SourceText: 🔄 Then build something new and let the next story begin!
text: 🔄 Bou dan iets anders en laat die volgende storie begin!

SourceText: Did you know that these imagination games help your child develop thinking, creativity, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination? All from a few simple pegs and a lot of imagination! 💡
text: Het jy geweet dat hierdie verbeeldingspeletjies jou kind se denkwyse, kreatiwiteit, fyn motoriese vaardighede en hand-oog-koördinasie ontwikkel? Alles met 'n paar eenvoudige pennetjies en baie verbeelding! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI
text: Aangepas uit UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI

SourceText: *Wind Power*
text: *Windkrag*

SourceText: Let’s explore the magic of wind with a fun movement game! ✨
text: Kom ons verken die towerkrag van wind met 'n prettige bewegingspeletjie! ✨

SourceText: 👀 First, talk with your child about the wind. Can you see it? Taste it? How does it feel on your hair or your skin?
text: 👀 Gesels eerstens met jou kind oor die wind. Kan jy dit sien? Dit proe? Hoe voel dit op jou hare of jou vel?

SourceText: 🔶 Take a piece of card or a leaf, close your eyes, and blow it using your own wind power. Watch how it moves!
text: 🔶 Neem 'n stukkie karton of 'n blaar, maak jou oë toe en blaas dit deur jou eie windkrag. Hou dop hoe dit beweeg!

SourceText: 🔵 Now try heavier things. Can you blow a spoon or small stones? What’s different?
text: 🔵 Probeer nou swaarder goed. Kan jy 'n lepel of klippies blaas? Wat is anders?

SourceText: 🎨 Time to play with water and wind! Drop small amounts of water on a plate or piece of plastic. Blow the water gently across the surface - you can make a straw to blow through by rolling up a small piece of paper.
text: 🎨 Tyd om met water en wind te speel! Drup klein bietjies water op 'n bord of 'n stuk plastiek. Blaas die water saggies oor die oppervlak - jy kan 'n strooitjie maak om deur te blaas deur 'n stukkie papier op te rol.

SourceText: 🏆 You can even place objects and try blowing the water around them to trace their shape.
text: 🏆 Jy kan selfs voorwerpe daarop plaas en die water rondom blaas om die vorm na te spoor.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps your child understand movement, space, and airflow - while sparking creativity and laughter 💡
text: Hierdie sensoriese aktiwiteit help om beweging, spasie en lugvloei te verstaan - terwyl kreatiwiteit en vrolikheid aangewakker word💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow
text: Aangepas uit UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow

SourceText: *Blanket Forts*
text: *Kombersforte*

SourceText: Let’s dive into creating your very own cosy hideaway! 🧸
text: Kom ons begin om jou eie gesellige wegkruipplek te maak! 🧸

SourceText: 👋 First, gather everything you’ll need - blankets, pillows, chairs, and maybe even a table. If you want to add a little magic, grab a light to light up your fort.
text: 👋 Eerstens, maak alles bymekaar wat jy gaan nodig hê - komberse, kussings en miskien ook 'n tafel. Indien jy 'n bietjie misterie wil byvoeg, kry 'n lig om jou fort te verlig.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, it’s time to build. Start by setting up two chairs facing each other, or use a table as the main structure of your fort.
text: 🔷 Nou is dit tyd om te bou. Begin deur twee stoele teenoor mekaar te sit, of gebruik die tafel as die hoofstruktuur van die fort.

SourceText: 👋 Drape the blankets over the chairs or table to create a roof. Don’t forget to secure them - use clothing pegs or something heavy to hold everything in place so your fort stays strong!
text: 👋 Drapeer die komberse oor die stoele of tafel om 'n dak te vorm. Moenie vergeet om dit stewig vas te maak nie - gebruik wasgoedpennetjies of iets swaar om alles in plek te hou, sodat jou fort staande bly!

SourceText: 🔴 Next, make the inside extra comfy with pillows or blankets.
text: 🔴 Maak nou die binnekant ekstra gemaklik met kussings of komberse.

SourceText: 🎈 Once your fort is built, add some fun touches. Ask your child to bring their favourite toys or books, and decorate the space however you like.
text: 🎈 Sodra jou fort klaar is, voeg 'n paar prettige goed by. Vra jou kind om sy/haar gunstelingspeelgoed of boeke te bring en versier die spasie net soos jy wil.

SourceText: 📝 You could even make a “welcome” sign together to make it feel like your very own special house!
text: 📝 Julle kan selfs saam 'n "welkom"-teken maak sodat dit soos jul eie spesiale huis voel!

SourceText: 🌙 Now, crawl inside and enjoy your new fort! This is your cosy, creative space for reading stories, playing games, or just spending some quiet time together.
text: 🌙 Kruip nou binne-in en geniet julle nuwe fort! Hierdie is jul gesellige, kreatiewe spasie vir stories lees, speletjies speel, of net om stiltetyd saam te spandeer.

SourceText: Building a blanket fort is more than just a fun activity - it’s a chance to spark creativity, solve problems, and share special moments together. So, grab those blankets and start building your adventure today! 💡
text: Om 'n kombersfort te bou, is meer as net 'n prettige aktiwiteit - dis 'n geleentheid om kreatiwiteit aan te wakker, probleme op te los en spesiale oomblikke saam te deel. Gryp daardie komberse en begin bou aan jou avontuur!💡

SourceText: *Tricky Tower*
text: *Stapeltoring*

SourceText: Here is an exciting activity that will test your child’s ability to estimate risks, work as a team, and think creatively - all while having fun and developing fine motor skills ⭐
text: Hier is 'n opwindende aktiwiteit wat jou kind se vermoë sal toets om risiko te evalueer, in 'n span te werk en kreatief te dink - alles terwyl hy/sy dit geniet en sy/haar fyn motoriese vaardighede ontwikkel word⭐

SourceText: 🔶 Start by giving your child building blocks or something else they can stack.
text: 🔶 Begin deur vir jou kind boublokkies te gee, of iets wat hy/sy op mekaar kan stapel.

SourceText: 👋 Ask them to build a tower by stacking the blocks, using just one hand. This challenge helps build focus and concentration as they balance the blocks carefully.
text: 👋 Vra hom/haar om 'n toring te bou deur net een hand te gebruik om blokkies op mekaar te stapel. Hierdie uitdaging help om fokus en konsentrasie te bevorder terwyl hy/sy die blokkies versigtig balanseer.

SourceText: ⬆️ If other children or adults are around, you can make it into a match to see who can build the tallest tower the fastest.
text: ⬆️ As ander kinders en volwassenes teenwoordig is, kan julle dit 'n kompetisie maak om te kyk wie kan die hoogste toring die vinnigste bou.

SourceText: 🔄 Make the game even more challenging by asking your child to using their non-dominant hand. They’ll have to balance their wish to build the tallest tower with the risk of the tower collapsing.
text: 🔄 Maak die speletjie selfs meer uitdagend deur jou kind te vra om die nie-dominante hand te gebruik. Dit sal sy/haar wens om die hoogste toring te bou, balanseer met die risiko dat die toring in duie kan stort.

SourceText: This isn’t just about building - it’s about problem-solving, persistence, and teamwork 💛
text: Dit gaan hier nie net oor bou nie - dit gaan oor probleemoplossing, volharding en spanwerk 💛

SourceText: Tricky Tower is a fantastic way to help your child develop important skills while having fun with friends or family 🏆
text: Die stapeltoring is 'n fantastiese manier om jou kind te help om belangrike vaardighede te ontwikkel terwyl hy/sy dit saam met vriende of familie geniet 🏆

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower

SourceText: *Flip the blanket*
text: *Draai die Kombers om*

SourceText: Can you and your child flip a blanket while standing on it? 🚩
text: Kan jy en jou kind 'n kombers omdraai terwyl julle daarop staan? 🚩

SourceText: ⬇️ Start by laying a blanket or large piece of cloth flat on the ground. Have all the players stand on the blanket - make sure no one steps off!
text: ⬇️ Begin deur 'n kombers of 'n groot stuk lap op die grond te sit. Laat al die spelers op die kombers staan - maak seker dat niemand afklim nie!

SourceText: 👋 Now, the challenge begins. The players must work together to flip the blanket over without stepping off or touching the ground.
text: 👋 Nou begin die uitdaging. Al die spelers moet saamwerk om die kombers om te draai, sonder om af te klim of die grond te raak.

SourceText: 🔑 Experiment with different ideas, try new strategies, and see what works best!
text: 🔑 Eksperimenteer met verskillende idees, probeer nuwe strategieë en kyk wat die beste werk!

SourceText: 🔄 If anyone touches the ground, no worries - just start over and give it another try.
text: 🔄 As enigiemand die grond raak, geen probleem - begin net oor en probeer weer.

SourceText: 👀 While you are playing, talk about the problem-solving you are doing. Ask the players what ideas they are trying and why, how they are working together, and what is working and what is not. Discuss how they came up with solutions as a team.
text: 👀 Terwyl julle speel, gesels oor die probleemoplossing wat julle nou doen. Vra die spelers watter idees hulle probeer en hoekom, hoe hulle saam werk, wat werk en wat werk nie. Bespreek hoe hulle as 'n span met die oplossing vorendag gekom het.

SourceText: Flip the Blanket is a fantastic way to encourage teamwork, creative thinking, problem solving, and perseverance - all while having a great time together! 🎉
text: Draai-die-Kombers-om is 'n fantastiese manier om spanwerk, kreatiewe denkwyse, probleemoplossing en deursettingsvermoë aan te moedig - alles terwyl julle 'n wonderlike tyd saam het! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket

SourceText: *Can You Catch It?*
text: *Kan Jy Dit Vang?*

SourceText: Let’s see if you can follow instructions while catching a ball! ⚽
text: Kom ons kyk of jou kind instruksies kan volg terwyl hy/sy 'n bal vang! ⚽

SourceText: ✅ Start by standing about three metres apart and gently throw a ball at each other. After a few easy throws, it’s time to introduce the rules!
text: ✅ Begin deur so drie meter uitmekaar te staan en gooi die bal versigtig vir mekaar. Na 'n paar maklike gooie, is dit tyd om die reëls bekend te stel!

SourceText: 1️⃣ When the thrower shouts ‘one’, the catcher has to catch the ball with their right hand and put their left foot out.
text: 1️⃣ Wanneer die gooier 'een' skree, moet die vanger die bal met sy/haar regterhand vang en sy/haar linkervoet uitsit.

SourceText: 2️⃣ If the thrower shouts ‘two’, the catcher catches with their left hand and puts their right foot out.
text: 2️⃣ As die gooier 'twee' skree, moet die vanger met die bal met sy/haar linkerhand vang en sy/haar regtervoet uitsit.

SourceText: ⭐ Once you’re confident, add some extra numbers and rules!
text: ⭐ Sodra julle selfversekerd is, voeg 'n paar ekstra getalle by!

SourceText: ⏰ For the game to work, make sure the number is called before you throw the ball, so the catcher has time to react!
text: ⏰ Vir die speletjie om te werk, maak seker dat die getal geroep is voordat die bal gegooi word, sodat die vanger tyd het om te reageer!

SourceText: 🚩 You can adjust the rules to make it perfect for every age.
text: 🚩 Jy kan die reëls aanpas om dit perfek te maak vir enige ouderdom.

SourceText: This activity is a great way to improve coordination, concentration, and quick thinking - all while having fun! So, grab a ball and start throwing with these new rules to test your skills! 💡
text: Hierdie aktiwiteit is 'n goeie manier om koördinasie, konsentrasie en vinnige denke te verbeter - alles terwyl daar pret is! So, gryp 'n bal en begin gooi met die nuwe reëls om jou vaardighede te toets! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it

SourceText: *Unseen Guesses*
text: *Ongesiene Raaiskote*

SourceText: You can do this activity when you are together with at least three people in total 3️⃣
text: Jy kan hierdie aktiwiteit doen wanneer jy saam met ten minste drie mense in totaal is 3️⃣

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child and another child/adult to sit next to each other. Blindfold both using a scarf or hat.
text: 👀 Vra jou kind en 'n ander kind/volwassene om langs mekaar te sit. Blinddoek beide met 'n serp of hoed.

SourceText: 🚗 Give your child an object and ask them to feel it and describe it, without saying the name of the object!
text: 🚗 Gee jou kind 'n voorwerp en vra dat hy/sy daaraan voel en dit beskryf, sonder om die naam van die voorwerp te sê!

SourceText: 🎁 The other person’s job is to figure out what the object is based on the description.
text: 🎁 Die ander persoon moet raai wat die voorwerp is, gebaseer op die beskrywing.

SourceText: ✅ The “guesser” can ask questions, but the “speaker” can only answer with "yes" or "no".
text: ✅ Die "raaier" kan vrae vra, maar die "spreker" kan net "ja" of "nee" antwoord.

SourceText: 🔄 After each round, swap roles and play again, giving everyone a chance to be the “speaker” and “guesser” and the one to provides the object.
text: 🔄 Na elke rondte, ruil rolle om en speel weer, gee elkeen kans om die "spreker", die "raaier" en die verskaffer van die voorwerpe te wees.

SourceText: This game is not only fun but also helps children develop strong communication skills and teaches them how to work together to achieve a goal. Enjoy working through the challenge of Unseen Guesses! 💚
text: Hierdie speletjie is nie net pret nie, maar dit help kinders om sterk kommunikasievaardighede te ontwikkel, om saam te werk en om doelwitte te bereik. Geniet die uitdaging van Ongesiene Raaiskote! 💚

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses

SourceText: *Things that Make Me Happy*
text: *Dinge wat my Gelukkig maak*

SourceText: Let’s take some time to appreciate the little things that make us feel happy every day 😃
text: Laat ons die tyd neem om die klein goedjies wat ons elke dag gelukkig maak, te waardeer😃

SourceText: 💛 Start by talking with your child about the things that made you happy today. It could be anything - a friend, a favourite pet, an activity that made you smile.
text: 💛 Begin deur met jou kind te gesels oor dinge wat jou vandag gelukkig gemaak het. Dit kan enigiets wees - 'n vriend, 'n gunstelingtroeteldier, 'n aktiwiteit wat jou laat glimlag het.

SourceText: 👀 Next, find three things that represent what makes you happy and place them in a special container or box.
text: 👀 Volgende, vind drie dinge wat die dinge wat jou gelukkig maak, verteenwoordig, en plaas dit in 'n spesiale houer of boks.

SourceText: 🎨 If the things that make you happy are too big to fit in the box, or if you can’t find something to represent them, you can draw them!
text: 🎨 As die goed wat jou gelukkig maak, te groot is om in die houer te pas, of as jy nie iets kan kry wat dit verteenwoordig nie, kan jy dit teken!

SourceText: 👂 Once everything is in the box, discuss what you and your child chose. Ask them why these things make them happy. It’s a great way to get them talking about positive emotions.
text: 👂 Sodra alles in die houer is, bespreek wat jy en jou kind gekies het. Vra hom/haar hoekom hierdie goed hom/haar gelukkig maak. Dis 'n wonderlike manier om hom/haar oor positiewe emosies te laat praat.

SourceText: You can play this game as often as you like - even daily! Doing this before bed can help your child stay motivated, happy, and calm, especially during tough times.
text: Julle kan die speletjie so dikwels speel as wat julle wil - selfs daagliks! Om dit voor slaaptyd te doen, kan help dat jou kind meer gemotiveerd, gelukkig en kalm bly, veral deur rowwe tye.

SourceText: So, gather those happy things and create a special box full of joy! ⭐
text: So, versamel daardie gelukkige goed en maak 'n spesiale boks vol vreugde!⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy

SourceText: *Nature Game*
text: *Natuurspeletjie*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun exploring the world around you with a nature-themed game! You can play it anywhere - at the beach, around your house, or even on a walk 🌷
text: Geniet dit om die wêreld rondom julle te verken deur 'n speletjie met 'n natuur-tema! Julle kan dit enige plek speel - by die see, rondom julle huis, of selfs op 'n uitstappie 🌷

SourceText: 📝 First, draw a grid of 3 by 3 on a piece of paper and write something in each box that you might find in nature - like a tree, flower, rock, bird, or cloud.
text: 📝 Eerstens, teken 'n tabel van 3 by 3 op 'n stuk papier en skryf iets in elke blok wat jy dalk in die natuur kan vind - soos 'n boom, blom, klip, voël of wolk.

SourceText: 👀 Now, it’s time to explore! Head outside and start searching for the items on your card.
text: 👀 Nou is dit tyd om bietjie te verken! Gaan uit en begin soek vir die items op jou kaart.

SourceText: ✅ Each time you find something, mark it off.
text: ✅ Elke keer as jy iets vind, merk dit af.

SourceText: 🏆 You decide when you win! Maybe it’s when you’ve marked off a whole line, or perhaps when you’ve found everything on your card. It’s completely up to you!
text: 🏆 Jy besluit wanneer jy wen! Miskien is dit wanneer jy 'n hele ry afgemerk het, of dalk wanneer jy alles op die kaart gekry het. Dis geheel en al jou keuse!

SourceText: Nature Game is a great way for your child to explore the outdoors, boost concentration, and have fun while learning more about the world around them. So, get outside and start your nature game! 🌱
text: Natuurspeletjie is 'n goeie manier vir jou kind om die buitelug te verken, sy/haar selfvertroue 'n hupstoot te gee en pret te hê terwyl hy/sy meer leer oor die wêreld om hom/haar. So, gaan uit en begin julle natuurspeletjie!🌱

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo

SourceText: *Baking Time*
text: *Baktyd*

SourceText: Baking isn’t just about creating something delicious - it’s a fun and exciting way to learn new skills while exploring creativity 🍞
text: Om te bak, is nie net om iets lekker te maak nie - dis 'n prettige en opwindende manier om nuwe vaardighede te leer, terwyl julle jul kreatiwiteit verken🍞

SourceText: From mixing to serving, your young chef will feel a sense of pride and accomplishment as they bring their tasty creations to life! ⭐
text: Vanaf meng tot bedien sal jou jong kok 'n gevoel van trots en prestasie voel terwyl hy/sy sy/haar smaaklike skeppings in die lewe roep!⭐

SourceText: 📖 Here’s how to get started: Pick a simple recipe, like bread or cookies.
text: 📖 Hoe om te begin: Kies 'n eenvoudige resep, soos brood of koekies.

SourceText: 👋 Let your child help with all the steps - mixing ingredients, whisking the batter, and stirring everything together.
text: 👋 Laat jou kind met al die stappe help - meng bestanddele, klits die beslag en roer alles saam.

SourceText: 🎨 If you are making bread or cookies, invite your child to make shapes with the dough. Don’t be afraid to get messy!
text: 🎨 As julle brood of koekies maak, nooi jou kind om vorms met die deeg te maak. Moenie bang wees om vuil te word nie!

SourceText: 🚩 Once your treats are baking, the fun continues with cleaning up the mess!
text: 🚩 Sodra julle lekkernye bak, gaan die pret voort wanneer julle die gemors opruim!

SourceText: ✅ Once your goodies are ready, let your children take over again make the food look nice and serve it.
text: ✅ Sodra julle lekkernye gereed is, laat jou kinders weer die leiding neem en dit versier en bedien.

SourceText: 😃 Finally, enjoy the results together!
text: 😃 Uiteindelik kan julle die eindproduk saam geniet!

SourceText: You will have delicious food AND you’ll also have shared a special bonding moment while developing important skills like patience, focus, and creativity.
text: Jy sal heerlike kos hê EN julle sou ook spesiale tyd saam spandeer het en belangrike vaardighede ontwikkel het soos geduld, fokus en kreatiwiteit.

SourceText: So, grab what you need and let the baking fun begin! ✨
text: So, kry alles wat jy nodig het en laat die bakpret begin!✨

SourceText: *Secret Handshake*
text: *Geheime Handdruk*

SourceText: Let’s make a special, fun, and unique handshake that only you and your child share 👋
text: Kom ons maak 'n spesiale, prettige en unieke handdruk wat net jy en jou kind deel👋

SourceText: 🔶 First, sit down together and talk about the kind of handshake you want. Should it be quick and silly, or cool and complicated? It’s totally up to you!
text: 🔶 Eerstens, dink eers oor die tipe handdruk wat julle wil hê. Moet dit vinnig en laf wees, of oulik en ingewikkeld? Dis geheel en al julle keuse!

SourceText: 🎵 You can start by choosing a few simple moves like clapping patterns, high fives, fist bumps, or snapping fingers.
text: 🎵 Julle kan begin deur 'n paar eenvoudige bewegings te kies, soos klappatrone, high fives, vuisstampe of vingersklap.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, practice adding different steps. Maybe a spin, a shoulder tap, or even a fun dance move. The more creative and playful, the better!
text: 🔄 Volgende, oefen om verskillende stappe by te voeg. Dalk 'n draai, 'n skouertikkie of selfs 'n prettige dansbeweging. Hoe meer kreatief en speels, hoe beter!

SourceText: 💛 Once you’ve mastered your moves, make your secret handshake a part of your routine! Use it as a fun greeting after school, or anytime you want to feel that special connection.
text: 💛 Sodra julle die bewegings bemeester het, maak jul geheime handdruk deel van jul roetine! Gebruik dit as 'n prettige manier om te groet na skool, of net wanneer jy daardie spesiale verbintenis wil voel.

SourceText: This isn’t just about having fun - it helps build your child’s confidence and teamwork skills while creating a special tradition you both can enjoy. ✅
text: Dit is nie net ter wille van pret nie - dit help om jou kind se selfvertroue en spanwerkvaardighede te bou, terwyl julle 'n spesiale tradisie skep wat albei kan geniet ✅

SourceText: *Create Silly Characters*
text: *Skep Lawwe Karakters*

SourceText: 🎨 All you need to play this game is a piece of paper and a pen or pencil.
text: 🎨 Al wat jy nodig het om die speletjie te speel, is papier en 'n pen of potlood.

SourceText: 1️⃣ The first person draws the top (head, hat, hair) of a character. This can be as serious or silly as you want it to be.
text: 1️⃣ Die eerste persoon teken die bokant (kop, hoed, hare) van 'n karakter. Dit kan so ernstig of so laf wees soos wat jy wil hê dit moet wees.

SourceText: 🔄 Fold the drawing to cover up what has been drawn but leave two lines to show where the next person who is drawing should pick up.
text: 🔄 Vou die tekening om die getekende gedeelte toe te maak, maar los twee lyne oop om te wys waar die volgende persoon wat moet teken, moet aangaan.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Pass the paper on to the next person, who, without seeing what has already been drawn, will contribute the next set of features to the character: The shoulders or tummy. Fold the paper back to cover up the image and pass it on.
text: 2️⃣ Gee die papier vir die volgende persoon wat, sonder om te weet wat reeds geteken is, die volgende stel kenmerke van die karakter sal byvoeg: Die skouers of magie. Vou die papier terug om die beeld toe te maak en stuur dit aan.

SourceText: 📝 Repeat until someone has drawn the feet of the character and then open your drawing up to see the masterpiece you have created together!
text: 📝 Herhaal totdat iemand die karakter se voete geteken het en maak dan die tekening oop om die meesterstuk wat julle saam geskep het, te sien!

SourceText: This game builds creativity, nurtures imagination, and helps teach kids to collaborate – while having lots of laughs! 🌈
text: Hierdie speletjie bou kreatiwiteit, koester verbeelding en help om kinders te leer om saam te werk - terwyl hulle baie pret het! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing
text: Aangepas uit Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing

SourceText: Get ready to put your animal knowledge to the test in this exciting guessing game! 🚩
text: Maak gereed om jou dierekennis te toets in hierdie opwindende raai-raai-speletjie!🚩

SourceText: 🧸 One person secretly picks an animal - don’t say which animal you’ve chosen!
text: 🧸 Een persoon kies in die geheim 'n dier - moenie sê watter dier jy gekies het nie!

SourceText: 💡 The other player asks questions to figure it out. You might ask, “Is the animal a mammal?” or “Can it fly?” Keep going until you guess correctly and then switch.
text: 💡 Die ander speler vra vrae om uit te werk wat die antwoord is. Jy kan vra, "Is die dier 'n soogdier?" of "Kan dit vlieg?" Hou aan tot jy reg geraai het en ruil dan om.

SourceText: 🔄 You can even play this game with multiple people by taking turns guessing and picking the animal!
text: 🔄 Jy kan selfs die speletjie met meer mense speel deur beurte te maak om te raai en die dier te kies!

SourceText: 👂 For added fun, younger kids can join by acting out the animal to give extra clues!
text: 👂 Vir ekstra pret kan jonger kinders die dier naboots om ekstra leidrade te gee!

SourceText: This game sharpens your child’s reasoning skills and strengthens their memory while having fun ⭐
text: Hierdie speletjie verskerp jou kind se redeneringsvermoë en hul geheue terwyl hulle pret het ⭐

SourceText: *A friendly chat*
text: *'n Vriendelike geselsie*

SourceText: Talk to your teen about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Praat met jou tiener oor iets waarin hulle belangstel! 😃

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your teen is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ 'n Maklike manier om met jou tiener te begin praat, is om hulle uit te vra oor iets waarin hulle belangstel. Julle kan byvoorbeeld praat oor sport, boeke, flieks, vriende, musiek, beroemde mense of skool.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your teen shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Jy sal dalk nie alles wat jou tiener vertel, interessant vind nie, maar dit is belangrik om te wys dat jy entoesiasties is en gewillig is om te leer.

SourceText: *Create your own Recipe*
text: *Ontwikkel jou eie Resep*

SourceText: Let your teen come up with a new meal idea!
text: Laat jou tiener vorendag kom met 'n nuwe idee vir 'n ete!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with @fields.child_nickname using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚 Skep 'n nuwe gereg saam met @fields.child_nickname deur bestanddele te gebruik waaroor hulle mal is!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔵 Together, choose two ingredients, and ask your teen to prepare a meal using them. For example: chicken and spinach, tomatoes and rice, maize and pumpkin.
text: 🔵 Kies saam twee bestanddele, en vra jou tiener om dit te gebruik om 'n ete voor te berei. Byvoorbeeld: hoender en spinasie, tamaties en rys, mielies en pampoen.

SourceText: 📝 If you enjoy the meal, make it something your family eats weekly and ask your teen to write it down for you, give the meal a name, and explain how to make it.
text: 📝 As julle die ete geniet, maak dit iets wat jou gesin weekliks eet, en vra jou tiener om dit vir jou neer te skryf, gee die gereg 'n naam en verduidelik hoe om dit te maak.

SourceText: ✨ If your teen notices that you are learning from their cooking, it will boost their confidence!
text: ✨ As jou tiener sien dat jy uit hulle kookvernuf leer, sal dit hulle selfvertroue 'n hupstoot gee!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with your teen using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚 Skep 'n nuwe gereg saam met jou tiener deur bestanddele te gebruik waaroor hulle mal is!

SourceText: *Reflect on the positive*
text: *Dink na oor die positiewe*

SourceText: Spread Positivity! 🌈
text: Versprei Positiwiteit! 🌈

SourceText: 💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today.
text: 💡 Neem saam 'n minuut om na te dink oor al die goed wat julle vandag gedoen het.

SourceText: ☀️ Take turns sharing one positive or fun thing that happened. This could be something small, like feeling good because you cleaned the house, or something big, like spending time with family and friends.
text: ☀️ Neem beurte om een positiewe of prettige ding wat gebeur het, te deel. Dit kan iets kleins wees, soos om goed te voel omdat julle die huis skoongemaak het, of iets groots, soos dat julle tyd saam met familie en vriende deurgebring het.

SourceText: ⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.
text: ⏰ Probeer om dit elke dag te doen - veral op die dae wat dit voel asof julle nie enigiets spesiaals gedoen het nie.

SourceText: *What’s new?*
text: *Wat’s nuut?*

SourceText: Learning is fun! 🎓
text: Leer is pret! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your teen to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓ Vra jou tiener om te dink aan 'n nuwe, pret-vaardigheid wat julle saam kan leer.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill.  Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Neem beurte om die nuwe vaardigheid te probeer. Maak seker dat julle mekaar prys, leer en saam speel!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your teen or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Benader die leer van die vaardigheid op 'n simpatieke en prettige manier, en moenie jouself of jou tiener afkraak oor julle vermoë in die vaardigheid nie.

SourceText: *Dance moves*
text: *Danspassies*

SourceText: Let's get moving! 👋 Dancing is a great way to exercise, have fun, and bond with your teen at the same time! You both get to express yourselves in a fun, relaxed way.  🎵
text: Kom ons beweeg! 👋 Dans is 'n wonderlike manier om te oefen, pret te hê, en terselfdertyd 'n band met jou tiener te vorm! Julle kry albei kans om julself op 'n prettige, ontspanne manier uit te druk.  🎵

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or a group with everyone taking turns being the leader:
text: Hierdie speletjie kan in pare of in 'n groep gespeel word, met almal wat beurte neem om die leier te wees:

SourceText: 📱 Let your teen choose a song they like and create a set of dance moves.
text: 📱 Laat jou tiener 'n liedjie kies waarvan hulle hou en ontwikkel 'n stel danspassies.

SourceText: 👀 First person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.
text: 👀 Die eerste persoon voer 'n danspassie uit en al die ander moet dit namaak.

SourceText: ☀️ Don’t worry about perfecting the dance moves, it’s all about having fun together!
text: ☀️ Moenie bekommerd wees as jul danspassies nie perfek is nie, dit gaan daaroor om saam pret te hê!

SourceText: 💡 If you want to, you can perform your dance for the household!
text: 💡 As jy wil, kan jy jou dans vir die huismense doen!

SourceText: *Dance Activity*
text: *Dansaktiwiteit*

SourceText: Try something new and learn a dance challenge with your teen! ✨ Have fun!
text: Probeer iets nuuts en leer 'n dansuitdaging saam met jou tiener! ✨ Geniet dit!

SourceText: ⭐ Dancing is a great way to have fun together while being creative and moving your body!
text: ⭐ Dans is 'n wonderlike manier om saam pret te hê terwyl julle kreatief besig is en jul liggame beweeg!

SourceText: 📱 If your teen uses the app TikTok, suggest doing a dance challenge together.
text: 📱 As jou tiener die app TikTok gebruik, stel voor dat julle saam 'n dansuitdaging doen.

SourceText: 😃 Ask your teen to choose their favourite dance and learn it with them.
text: 😃 Vra jou tiener om hulle gunsteling dans te kies, en leer dit saam met hulle.

SourceText: 🎉 It’s okay if you can’t dance well, have fun and try not to take it too seriously!
text: 🎉 Dis oukei as jy nie goed kan dans nie, geniet dit en probeer om dit nie te ernstig op te neem nie!

SourceText: 💡 You do not have to post the video to learn the dance. You can keep it as a memory between you and your teen.
text: 💡 Julle hoef nie die video op sosiale media te plaas om die dans te leer nie. Jy en jou tiener kan dit net vir julself as 'n herinnering hou.

SourceText: *Check-in chat*
text: *Inklok Klets*

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
text: Om aktief te kyk of die ander een oukei is, help om verhoudings gesond te hou! ⭐

SourceText: Ask each other questions: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂
text: Vra vir mekaar vrae: “Wat het jou vandag gelukkig gemaak?” 👂 “Wat was vandag moeilik?” 👂 “Hoe kan ek jou help?” 👂

SourceText: For this to help, your teen needs to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚 Teens tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
text: Dit sal slegs help as jou tiener veilig voel wanneer hulle goed met jou deel. Wees oop vir hulle antwoorde. 💚 Tieners is geneig om eerliker te wees as hulle vertrou dat wat hulle sê, nie later teen hulle gebruik sal word nie.

SourceText: Go easy on yourself if your teen does not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, teens are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷
text: Wees gaaf met jouself as jou tiener nie hulle probleme met jou wil deel nie. 💙 Tieners is dikwels bang om te deel, want hulle is bang hulle sal in die moeilikheid kom. Om vir hulle kwaad te word, sal nie help nie - hou aan om te wys dat jy lief is vir hulle en gee hulle tyd! 🌷

SourceText: *Express Yourself*
text: *Gee uiting aan Jouself*

SourceText: Dancing makes people happy!
text: Dans maak mense gelukkig!

SourceText: 🌈 This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: 🌈 Hierdie speletjie kan in pare of as 'n groep gespeel word - staan teenoor mekaar of in 'n sirkel.

SourceText: 🎵 Together, choose a fun and upbeat song to play and a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
text: 🎵 Kies saam 'n prettige, opgewekte liedjie om te speel en 'n persoon om die speletjie te begin deur een danspassie te skep.

SourceText: 👀 The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
text: 👀 Die persoon aan hulle regterkant moet daardie danspassie naboots en hulle eie danspassie byvoeg.

SourceText: ✨ Go around the circle, each person adding their own dance move to the full song.
text: ✨ Gaan in die rondte, elke persoon voeg hulle eie danspassie by tot aan die einde van die liedjie.

SourceText: 🔄 The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song and starts the game again.
text: 🔄 Die eerste een wat iemand se danspassies vergeet of dit in die verkeerde volgorde doen, kies die volgende liedjie en begin weer die speletjie.

SourceText: 🎉 Try new dance moves with this game and have fun!
text: 🎉 Probeer nuwe danspassies met hierdie speletjie en geniet dit!

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *2 Waarhede, 1 Leuen*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨
text: Hierdie speletjie is prettig en vinnig, en die doel daarvan is om meer oor mekaar uit te vind. Maak jou antwoorde so interessant as moontlik! 🎨

SourceText: 💡 Think of 3 facts about yourself. 2 must be true, 1 must be a lie.
text: 💡 Dink aan 3 stellings oor jouself. 2 moet waar wees en 1 moet 'n leuen wees.

SourceText: 🔷 Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I have travelled to Kenya, my favourite subject in school was maths.
text: 🔷 Hier is 'n paar voorbeelde: Ek haat piesangs, ek het na Kenia gereis, my gunsteling skoolvak was Wiskunde.

SourceText: 👀 Share the facts with your teen and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: 👀 Deel die feite met jou tiener en vra hulle om te raai watter een 'n leuen is.

SourceText: 🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: 🔄 Vra hulle nou om dieselfde te doen, en raai hulle s'n.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your teen, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛
text: Het jy enigiets nuuts oor jou tiener uitgevind, of het hulle iets nuuts oor jou uitgevind? 💛

SourceText: *Yes, No or Maybe*
text: *Ja, Nee of Miskien*

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈
text: Is jy moeg daarvan dat jou tiener ja, nee of miskien op al jou vrae antwoord? Verander julle geselsie in 'n speletjie, en moenie eenwoord-antwoorde toelaat nie. 🎈

SourceText: 🔴 Teens are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.
text: 🔴 Tieners is bekend daarvoor dat hulle eenwoord-antwoorde gee om 'n gesprek te vermy.

SourceText: 💡 When you would like to really know how your teen is doing, you can turn your chat into a game.
text: 💡 As jy regtig wil weet hoe dit met jou tiener gaan, kan jy julle geselsie in 'n speletjie verander.

SourceText: ⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
text: ⭐ Neem beurte om mekaar vrae te vra. Die enigste reël is dat julle nie eenwoord-antwoorde mag gee nie, soos Ja, Nee, Miskien, Goed en Oukei.

SourceText: ⚽ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
text: ⚽ Jy kan uitvra oor goed waarvan jou tiener hou of wat hulle vandag gedoen het. Byvoorbeeld, Hoe was jou dag? Waaroor is jy opgewonde? Is daar iets waaroor jy jou bekommer?

SourceText: 🔄 It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text: 🔄 Dit is belangrik om jou tiener toe te laat om ook 'n vraag te vra. Vertroue word gebou wanneer jou tiener kan sien dat jy ook jou lewe met hulle deel, en nie slegs probeer om meer oor hulle lewe uit te vind nie.

SourceText: *Movie World*
text: *Fliek-Wêreld*

SourceText: Leaving the busy and stressful world behind can be good for our health. 🌱 Take a moment to escape with your teen by creating a superhero story together!
text: Om die besige en stresvolle wêreld agter te laat, kan goed wees vir ons gesondheid. 🌱 Neem 'n oomblik om saam met jou tiener te ontsnap deur saam 'n superheld-storie te skep!

SourceText: 🎈 Ask your teen to imagine that they are a superhero and what their superpowers would be. Flying? Time travel? Mind reading? Super Strength?
text: 🎈Vra jou tiener om hulle te verbeel dat hulle 'n superheld is, en wat hulle superkragte sou wees. Vlieg? Tydreis? Gedagtes lees? Super Sterkte?

SourceText: ✨ Ask them how they would use these superpowers, and why.
text: ✨ Vra hoe hulle hierdie superkragte sou gebruik, en hoekom.

SourceText: 🌈 Help them give their superhero a name, an outfit, and a sidekick, and act it out. If your teen does not want to act, that is fine - talking about it is just as good!
text: 🌈 Help hulle om hulle superheld 'n naam te gee, asook 'n uitrusting en 'n helper, en speel hierdie rolle. As jou tiener nie wil toneelspeel nie, is dit oukei - dis net so goed om daaroor te praat!

SourceText: 👑 Now, let them make up a superhero for you. Play the part! You can ask questions, like who the villain would be, or how you became a superhero.
text: 👑 Laat hulle nou vir jou 'n superheld uitdink. Speel die rol! Jy kan vrae vra, soos wie die skurk sou wees, of hoe jy 'n superheld geword het.

SourceText: 💡 Create a story - what happens to the characters? Is it an action story? Is it a thriller, space, sport, adventure, or romance?
text: 💡 Skep 'n storie - wat gebeur met die karakters? Is dit 'n aksiestorie? Is dit 'n riller, ruimte, sport, avontuur of romanse?

SourceText: ➡️ Next time you play this game, you could create a new story or superhero with your teen or continue the story you started together.
text: ➡️ Volgende keer wat julle hierdie speletjie speel, kan jy saam met jou tiener 'n nuwe storie skep of voortgaan met die storie wat julle saam begin het.

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health. 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your teen want to do and try it out together!
text: Oefening is 'n wonderlike manier om tyd saam deur te bring, en dit is so goed vir jou gesondheid. 🌱 Vind 'n sport of oefening wat jy en jou tiener albei wil doen en probeer dit saam!

SourceText: ⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport..
text: ⚽ Saam kan julle stap, hardloop, sokker speel, swem, dans, of enige ander sport doen.

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your teen do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: 🔄 As jy of jou tiener nie hou van die eerste oefening wat julle gekies het nie, probeer 'n nuwe een.

SourceText: *Make up a story*
text: *Dink 'n storie uit*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to learn the art of storytelling - and to build your teen’s creativity! 📖
text: Om saam stories te skep, is 'n wonderlike manier om die kuns van storievertel aan te leer - en jou tiener se kreatiwiteit te ontwikkel! 📖

SourceText: 🔟 With your teen, come up with 10 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, wasp nest, cooking, wedding.
text: 🔟 Dink saam met jou tiener aan 10 woorde om te gebruik. Dit kan enige woorde wees wat julle wil! Byvoorbeeld: piesang, ruimtetuig, vis, water, skildery, perdebynes, kook, troue.

SourceText: 🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and make sure you use one of the words from the list in your sentence. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”
text: 🎂 Begin julle storie met “Eendag, lank, lank gelede was daar 'n…” en maak seker dat julle een van die woorde uit die lys in julle sin gebruik. Byvoorbeeld, “Eendag, lank, lank gelede was daar 'n gesin wat op 'n *piesang*-plaas gewerk het.”

SourceText: 📝 Let your teen make up the next sentence using another word from the list.
text: 📝 Laat jou tiener die volgende sin uitdink deur nog 'n woord uit die lys te gebruik.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns until you have used as many words from the list as you can, or until you have finished your story.
text: 🔄 Neem beurte totdat julle soveel as moontlik woorde uit die lys gebruik het, of totdat julle die storie voltooi het.

SourceText: 🔔 Be as creative as possible with your story and do not tell your teen what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be a good story!
text: 🔔 Wees so kreatief as moontlik met julle storie, en moenie vir jou tiener voorskryf wat om te sê nie. Dit hoef nie 'n ware storie te wees om 'n goeie storie te wees nie!

SourceText: 🎁 Ask your teen what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: 🎁 Vra jou tiener wat hulle gunsteling deel van die storie was, en sê wat joune was!

SourceText: *Take A Pause with your teen*
text: *Ontspan 'n rukkie saam met jou tiener*

SourceText: Take a pause with your teen. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Ontspan 'n rukkie saam met jou tiener. Dit help hulle om stres op 'n gesonde manier te hanteer!

SourceText: ⏰ You could take a pause before dinner, after school, before school, or before bedtime.
text: ⏰ Julle kan voor aandete, na skool, voor skool of voor slaaptyd 'n bietjie ontspan.

SourceText: 👂 Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel.
text: 👂 Gaan sit saam en maak julle oë toe. Luister na jul asemhaling terwyl julle in- en uitasem. Neem kennis van hoe julle voel.

SourceText: ⭐ Take 5 more deep breaths.
text: ⭐ Haal nog 5 keer diep asem.

SourceText: 👀 When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: 👀 Wanneer julle gereed is, maak jul oë weer oop. Voel julle enigsins anders?

SourceText: ⏸ Ask your teen what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.
text: ⏸ Vra jou tiener hoe dit was om 'n rukkie te ontspan. Luister en aanvaar wat ook al hulle daaroor sê.

SourceText: *Name That Tune*
