text: *Liedjieraai*

SourceText: Listening to music is a great way to lower your stress and have fun with your family. 💚
text: Om na musiek te luister, is 'n wonderlike manier om jou stresvlakke te laat daal en pret saam met jou gesin te hê. 💚

SourceText: 📻 Gather your family members and choose one person to play, sing or hum a song.
text: 📻 Kry jou familielede bymekaar en kies een persoon om 'n liedjie te speel, sing of neurie.

SourceText: ❓ Everyone else must guess the name and artist of the song.
text: ❓ Al die ander moet die naam en kunstenaar van die liedjie raai.

SourceText: 🎉 The first one to guess it right becomes the next person to sing or play a song.
text: 🎉 Die eerste een wat reg raai, is die volgende persoon wat 'n liedjie speel of sing.

SourceText: 🔄 Keep going around until everyone has been able to play their favourite song and let the rest hear.
text: 🔄 Hou so aan totdat almal 'n beurt gehad het om hul gunsteling liedjie te speel/sing en die res laat luister het.

SourceText: *Pass the ball*
text: *Gee die bal aan*

SourceText: ➡️ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: ➡️ Begin in 'n sirkel en gee die bal aan.

SourceText: *Make Housework Fun*
text: *Maak Huistake Pret*

SourceText: Turn your chores into games! 🏆
text: Verander jul huistake in speletjies! 🏆

SourceText: ☀️ Making housework fun is a good way to teach your teen to be responsible and to rely on themselves.
text: ☀️ Om huiswerk pret te maak, is 'n goeie manier om jou tiener verantwoordelikheid te leer en om op hulself staat te maak.

SourceText: 📝 Together, make a list of all the chores that must be done in your home.
text: 📝 Maak saam 'n lysie van al die huistake wat in julle huis gedoen moet word.

SourceText: 💡 Make sure the tasks are fair and things your teen can do. For example, washing up, sweeping, mopping, making the beds, and laundry.
text: 💡 Maak seker die take is regverdig en dat dit goed is wat jou tiener kan doen. Byvoorbeeld, skottelgoed, vee, mop, beddens opmaak en wasgoed.

SourceText: 🔄 Each week, let a different person in the family choose a chore first.
text: 🔄 Laat 'n ander persoon in die gesin elke week eerste 'n taak kies.

SourceText: 🎵 Play some music or turn on the radio. Music is a great way to make a boring task fun!
text: 🎵 Speel musiek of skakel die radio aan. Musiek is 'n wonderlike manier om 'n vervelige taak prettig te maak!

SourceText: ✅ Tick off the tasks when they are done so you can see your progress as a family. You could offer small rewards as motivation to complete activities.
text: ✅ Merk die take af wanneer dit klaar is, sodat julle as gesin jul vordering kan sien. Jy kan klein belonings as motivering aanbied om aktiwiteite te voltooi.

SourceText: 📺 For example, you could let your teen watch more TV, spend more time with their friends, choose what they want for dinner, or have something sweet if they do their chores in a fair amount of time.
text: 📺 Jy kan byvoorbeeld jou tiener meer TV laat kyk, meer tyd saam met vriende laat deurbring, laat kies wat hulle vir aandete wil hê, of soetgoed gee as hulle, hulle take binne 'n redelike tyd afhandel.

SourceText: ❓ If your child does not complete a chore, ask them why, and come up with a fair consequence together.
text: ❓ As jou kind nie 'n taak afhandel nie, vra hulle hoekom, en dink saam 'n regverdige gevolg uit.

SourceText: *I’m Going on a Picnic and I Will Bring…*
text: *Ek Gaan na 'n Piekniek en Ek Bring Saam …*

SourceText: Memory games are a fun way to strengthen our brains!
text: Geheuespeletjies is 'n prettige manier om ons breine te versterk!

SourceText: 🎂 Think of all the things you would have at your dream picnic.
text: 🎂 Dink aan al die goed wat jy by jou droompiekniek sal hê.

SourceText: 🎈 The first person says, “On Saturday, I am going to the park to have a picnic. To this picnic, I will bring...” and they say one thing they will bring to the picnic.
text: 🎈 Die eerste persoon sê, “Saterdag gaan ek in die park piekniek hou. Vir die piekniek bring ek...” en noem een ding wat hulle saamneem vir die piekniek.

SourceText: 🍅 For example: a sandwich, a ball, a blanket, forks, cups, a dog, or coca cola.
text: 🍅 Byvoorbeeld: 'n toebroodjie, 'n bal, 'n kombers, vurke, koppies, 'n hond of coca cola.

SourceText: 🔔 The second person adds to the first person's list, but must start at the beginning: “On Saturday, I am going to the park to have a picnic. To this picnic, I will bring...” and say the item that the first person said AND then add their own item to the list.
text: 🔔 Die tweede persoon voeg by die eerste persoon se lys aan, maar moet weer oor begin: “Saterdag gaan ek in die park piekniek hou. Vir die piekniek bring ek...” en sê die item wat die eerste persoon gesê het EN voeg dan hulle eie item by die lys.

SourceText: 🔄 Each time you add an item, you must say all previous items first - in the correct order!
text: 🔄 Elke keer as jy 'n item byvoeg, moet jy eers al die vorige items sê - in die korrekte volgorde!

SourceText: ⭐ Each person adds to the list, while remembering all the previous items.
text: ⭐ Elke persoon voeg 'n item by die lys, terwyl hulle al die vorige items onthou.

SourceText: 👀 If everyone has a turn, keep going and building your list. The first person to forget an item restarts the game!
text: 👀 As almal 'n beurt gehad het, hou aan om die lys langer te maak. Die eerste persoon wat 'n item vergeet, begin die speletjie oor!

SourceText: *This is who I am*
text: * Dit is wie ek is*

SourceText: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your teen to have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! 🏆
text: Selfbeeld is die manier waarop jy jouself na waarde skat, op 'n positiewe of negatiewe manier. Om jou tiener te help om 'n goeie selfbeeld te hê, is 'n suksesresep! 🏆

SourceText: ⭐Share with your teen 3 things you like about yourself!
text: ⭐Deel met jou tiener 3 dinge van jouself waarvan jy hou!

SourceText: 3️⃣ Ask your teen to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.
text: 3️⃣ Vra jou tiener om vir jou 3 dinge van hulself te noem waaarvan hulle hou.

SourceText: For example: I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at styling my hair. I am great at football. ⚽
text: Byvoorbeeld: Ek is wonderlik daarmee om ander mense goed te behandel. Ek kan my hare baie goed versorg. Ek is fantasties in sokker. ⚽

SourceText: If your teen does not feel comfortable sharing these, ask them to write them down. 📝
text: As jou tiener nie gemaklik daarmee voel om hierdie dinge te sê nie, vra hulle om dit neer te skryf. 📝

SourceText: *Things I like about others and me*
text: *Dinge in ander en myself waarvan ek hou*

SourceText: Here is an activity to help you and your teen notice the good parts of themselves.
text: Hier is 'n aktiwiteit om jou en jou tiener te help om die goeie dele van hulself raak te sien.

SourceText: ☀️Ask your teen to share 3 things they like about a friend or someone they admire, like a celebrity.
text: ☀️Vra jou tiener om 3 dinge te noem waarvan hulle hou in 'n vriend of iemand wat hulle bewonder, soos 'n beroemde persoon.

SourceText: ❓ Ask them if they share any of these qualities, too.
text: ❓ Vra hulle of hulle ook oor enige van hierdie eienskappe beskik.

SourceText: 💙 You can do the same: share with your teen the qualities you like about yourself or about someone you admire - and what you like about your teen!
text: 💙 Jy kan dieselfde doen: deel met jou tiener die eienskappe waarvan jy in jouself of iemand wat jy bewonder, hou - en waarvan jy in jou tiener hou!

SourceText: *Make a family wish list*
text: *Stel 'n gesins wenslys op*

SourceText: Wish lists are a great way to set, plan and keep track of your goals and dreams. 🌷
text: Wenslyste is 'n wonderlike manier om julle doelwitte en drome vas te stel, te beplan en die vordering daarvan dop te hou. 🌷

SourceText: 📝 To start your wish list, gather your family together and grab pens and paper.
text: 📝 Om met julle wenslys te begin, kry jou gesin bymekaar en gryp penne en papier.

SourceText: 🚲 Allow each family member to write a list of goals and experiences they want to achieve this year.
text: 🚲 Laat elke gesinslid 'n lys van doelwitte en ervarings wat hulle vanjaar wil behaal en ervaar, neerskryf.

SourceText: 🎂 For example: exercise daily, read 1 book a month, make a new friend, learn to bake a cake, learn to juggle, or go watch the local soccer team play.
text: 🎂 Byvoorbeeld: oefen daagliks, lees 1 boek per maand, maak 'n nuwe vriend, leer om koek te bak, leer om te "juggle", of gaan kyk wanneer die plaaslike sokkerspan speel.

SourceText: 🔔 Once you have finished, put the list up where everyone can see it daily.
text: 🔔 Wanneer julle klaar is, sit die lys iewers op waar almal dit elke dag kan sien.

SourceText: 🎉 As members of the family reach their goals, tick them off the list and celebrate each goal reached.
text: 🎉 Wanneer gesinslede hul doelwitte bereik, merk dit af op die lys en vier elke doelwit wat behaal is.

SourceText: ❓ As the year goes on, there might be some items some of you have not achieved. Talk to your family about whether you still want to reach this goal or whether the goal has changed.
text: ❓ Soos die jaar verbygaan, is daar dalk van die items wat sommige van julle nog nie behaal het nie. Praat met jou gesin oor of julle steeds hierdie doelwit wil bereik en of die doelwit dalk verander het.

SourceText: 🔑 If you still want to achieve the goal, discuss with your family what you need to do to tick the goal off your wish list.
text: 🔑 As jy steeds die doelwit wil behaal, bespreek met jou gesin wat jy moet doen om dit op jou wenslysie te kan afmerk.

SourceText: *Weekly Goal Setting*
text: *Weeklikse Doelwitstelling*

SourceText: Let’s set some goals ⭐
text: Kom ons stel 'n paar doelwitte vas ⭐

SourceText: ⏰ It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach. This helps us reach our larger goals over time.
text: ⏰ Dit kan help om kleiner weeklikse doelwitte te stel wat makliker is om te bereik. Dit help ons om ons groter doelwitte mettertyd te bereik.

SourceText: 💡Ask your teen for one goal that they would like to achieve this week.
text: 💡Vra jou tiener vir een doelwit wat hulle graag hierdie week wil bereik.

SourceText: 🔄 Make sure this goal is *specific* and  *achievable* to reach in 1 week.
text: 🔄 Maak seker hierdie doelwit is *spesifiek* en *bereikbaar* om in 1 week te bereik.

SourceText: 💚 You can also share your own weekly goal with your teen and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.
text: 💚 Jy kan ook jou eie weeklikse doel met jou tiener deel en julle kan mekaar ondersteun sodat julle albei jul doelwitte kan bereik.

SourceText: 🎉 Make sure to praise and celebrate your teen for their hard work towards reaching their goal.
text: 🎉 Maak seker dat jy jou tiener prys en vier vir hulle harde werk om hulle doelwit te bereik.

SourceText: 🔔 If your teen does not reach their goal, that is okay. Discuss with your teen the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.
text: 🔔 As jou tiener nie hulle doelwit bereik nie, is dit oukei. Bespreek die stappe met jou tiener wat hulle nog moet volg of hoe hulle dit op 'n ander manier kan bereik.

SourceText: *Think Big, Think Small*
text: *Dink Groot, Dink Klein"

SourceText: Working towards big goals can be hard! Here is a way you can help your teen set new goals for the things they want to achieve. 👑
text: Om na groot doelwitte te werk, kan moeilik wees! Hier is 'n manier waarop jy jou tiener kan help om nuwe doelwitte te stel vir dit wat hulle wil bereik. 👑

SourceText: 👑 Ask your teen to come up with three things that they are good at, and discuss what they did to become so good at them. For example: keeping their room neat, helping your family with housework, or playing a sport.
text: 👑 Vra jou tiener om drie dinge waarmee hulle goed is, te noem, en bespreek wat hulle gedoen het om so goed daarin te word. Byvoorbeeld: om hulle kamer skoon te hou, om die gesin met huistake te help, of 'n sport te speel.

SourceText: 🏆 Next, ask your teen what they wish they were good at.
text: 🏆 Vra jou tiener volgende wat hulle wens hulle mee goed was.

SourceText: 🔑 Remind them that it took work and practice to become good at the skills they have. They will have to do the same for any new goal.
text: 🔑 Herinner hulle dat dit werk en oefening gekos het om goed te raak in die vaardighede wat hulle het. Hulle sal dieselfde moet doen vir enige nuwe doelwit.

SourceText: ⏰ Help your teen break down their goal and set up smaller goals they need to achieve to reach their greater goal.
text: ⏰ Help jou tiener om hulle doelwit op te breek in kleiner doelwitte wat bereik moet word om hulle groot doelwit te bereik.

SourceText: 📝 It is much easier to achieve a goal if you write it down! This way, you can be reminded of it as you work towards it.
text: 📝 Dit is baie makliker om 'n doelwit te bereik as jy dit neerskryf! So kan jy daaraan herinner word terwyl jy daaraan werk.

SourceText: ☀️ For example, if the goal is to be good at football, small weekly goals could be to go to football practice 2 times per week, run at least 1 km 5 times per week, and learn about the sport from other football players in the community or from books or videos they find.
text: ☀️ As die doelwit byvoorbeeld is om goed in sokker te wees, kan klein weeklikse doelwitte wees om 2 keer per week sokkeroefening by te woon, ten minste 1 km 5 maal per week te hardloop, en om van ander sokkerspelers in die gemeenskap oor die sport te leer of uit boeke of video's wat hulle kry.

SourceText: ✅ It is important to write down these smaller goals and let your teen tick off each task as they do them each week. Seeing themselves reach smaller goals will keep them motivated to achieve the big goal!
text: ✅ Dit is belangrik vir jou tiener om hierdie kleiner doelwitte neer te skryf en elke taak af te merk soos hulle dit elke week doen. Om te sien hoe hulle kleiner doelwitte bereik, sal hulle gemotiveerd hou om die groot doelwit te bereik!

SourceText: *Role Playing*
text: *Rolspel*

SourceText: Let’s start acting! ⭐
text: Kom ons speel toneel! ⭐

SourceText: ❓ Role playing common stressful social moments with your teen allows them to practise how to respond so they are prepared if this moment does happen. 🌷
text: ❓ Om algemene stresvolle sosiale oomblikke met jou tiener te rolspel, laat hom/haar toe om voorbereid te wees en te weet hoe om te reageer wanneer dit werklik gebeur. 🌷

SourceText: ✨ Ask your teen if they want to role play with you. You can also suggest a topic. For example, asking someone on a date, saying no to drugs/alcohol/sexting, dealing with a bully, getting a bad grade, or dealing with gossip.
text: ✨ Vra jou tiener of hulle saam met jou rolspel wil doen. Jy kan ook 'n onderwerp voorstel. Byvoorbeeld, om iemand uit te vra vir 'n afspraak, nee te sê vir dwelms/alkohol/seksboodskappe ("sexting"), om 'n boelie te hanteer, swak punte te kry of skinderpraatjies te hanteer.

SourceText: 🌙 Your teen could play the role of a friend asking you to drink at a party. You could role play an underage teen who does not want to drink. Encourage your teen to be silly and really get into character with them.
text: 🌙 Jou tiener kan die rol speel van 'n vriend wat jou by 'n partytjie vra om te drink. Jy kan die rol van 'n minderjarige tiener speel wat nie wil drink nie. Moedig jou tiener aan om laf te wees en regtig saam met jou in karakter te kom.

SourceText: ⏯️ After you act out the scene, it is important to talk to your teen about the actions that you role played. You can act out this scenario as many times as you like!
text: ⏯️ Nadat julle die toneel uitgespeel het, is dit belangrik om met jou tiener te praat oor die aksies wat julle gerolspeel het. Julle kan hierdie scenario soveel keer speel as wat julle wil!

SourceText: *Traffic Lights*
text: *Robotte*

SourceText: A group activity is a great way to bond with others! 💛
text: 'n Groepsaktiwiteit is 'n wonderlike manier om bande met ander te bou! 💛

SourceText: 💡 Choose one person to turn and face a wall. This will be the traffic officer.
text: 💡 Kies een persoon om om te draai en na die muur te kyk. Dit is dan die verkeersbeampte.

SourceText: 🏁 Everyone else will begin the game at the other side of the room, or if you are outside, at a starting line. Set a long distance between the traffic officer and the players.
text: 🏁 Al die ander spelers begin die speletjie aan die anderkant van die vertrek, of as julle buite is, op 'n wegspringstreep. Daar moet 'n lang afstand tussen die verkeersbeampte en die spelers wees.

SourceText: 💚 The game begins when the officer shouts “Green”, and everyone can start moving towards the traffic officer at any speed they choose.
text: 💚 Die speletjie begin wanneer die beampte “Groen” skree, en almal begin na die verkeersbeampte beweeg teen die spoed van hulle keuse.

SourceText: 🔴 The officer can shout “Red!” at any time, without looking behind them. When they shout this, everyone must stop and freeze!
text: 🔴 Die beampte kan enige tyd “Rooi!” skree, sonder om agter hulle te kyk. Wanneer hulle dit skree, moet almal stop en vries!

SourceText: ⏸ The officer turns around to see if everyone is frozen. If they see anyone moving, they have to send them back to the start line.
text: ⏸ Die beampte draai om, om te sien of almal gevries het. As hulle iemand sien beweeg, moet hulle die persoon na die wegspringstreep terugstuur.

SourceText: 🏆 The winner is the first person to get to the officer without being sent back to the start.
text: 🏆 Die wenner is die eerste persoon wat tot by die beampte kom sonder om na die wegspringstreep teruggestuur te word.

SourceText: 👑 The winner then becomes the traffic officer and you can play another round!
text: 👑 Die wenner word dan die verkeersbeampte en julle kan nog 'n rondte speel!

SourceText: NEXT
text: VOLGENDE
note: This is a quick reply and its translation should be uniquely identified by the corresponding argument
